basic_info.about:
Founders waste 20+ hours/week manually searching Reddit for customers.I'm fixing that.
Building WhereTheyTalk after spending way too many nights scrolling through forums looking for people discussing problems my product could solve.

You know the drill:

- Opening 50 Reddit/X tabs
- Searching communities
- Missing conversations because you checked 3 hours too late
- Finding great discussions... from 2 years ago

WhereTheyTalk monitors millions of conversations across Reddit, X, Bluesky, Threads, dev.to, and HackerNews. When someone discusses the exact problem you solve, you get notified in real-time.

🔷 Revolutionising Medical Care Through AI Innovation

As the Founder and CEO of Eyes of AI™, I have the privilege of leading a dedicated team committed to revolutionising healthcare with cutting-edge AI solutions.

Eyes of AI™ is a global MedTech leader, specialising in developing integrated software that harnesses Machine Learning and Computer Vision to enhance diagnostic precision and patient care. We take pride in our industry-leading AI technologies that set new benchmarks for innovation in the field.

🏆 Award-Winning AI Dental Innovations

🏅 2023 NSW iAwards: Business and Industry Solution of the Year Winner
🏅 2023 National iAwards: Business and Industry Solution of the Year Merit

If you'd like to learn more about how Eyes of AI™ is transforming healthcare or explore potential collaboration opportunities, feel free to reach out to us.

experience.title: Founder & Chief Executive Officer at Eyes of AI™
experience.description:
Eyes of AI™ is a company that specialises in advanced diagnostic imaging and treatment planning for the dental industry. Established in 2020, our mission is to revolutionise dental care through the precise, efficient, and reliable interpretation of dental imaging.

Our proprietary AI technology accurately analyses and interprets various dental X-rays, including Orthopantomograms (OPG), Cone Beam Computed Tomography (CBCT), Periapical (PA) and Bitewing (BW) radiographs, offering clarity and diagnostic accuracy. The platform automates complex tasks such as landmark identification, teeth segmentation, pathology detection, and quantitative image analysis. This enables clinicians to deliver faster diagnoses, plan treatments more effectively, and enhance overall patient outcomes.

Designed specifically for radiologists, general dentists, periodontists, orthodontists, oral and maxillofacial surgeons, and other dental specialists, Eyes of AI™ seamlessly integrates into existing clinical workflows. This ensures rapid adoption, minimal disruption, and immediate improvements in practice efficiency and patient care quality.

Eyes of AI™ continuously advances its technology through strategic partnerships with renowned institutions including prominent universities, and global dental technology leaders. Our commitment to rigorous research, clinical validation, and regulatory excellence positions us at the forefront of dental AI innovation globally.

As a trusted partner for dental professionals worldwide, Eyes of AI™ not only simplifies diagnostic processes but also elevates the standard of care. By empowering clinicians with cutting-edge AI tools, we facilitate better clinical decisions, improve patient experiences, and significantly contribute to the future of dental healthcare.

Seth Watts is a strategic FinTech entrepreneur and Co-Founder of CampaignAgent, Australia's pioneering property marketing finance platform. With over two decades of expertise in real estate technology and services, Seth has built innovative solutions that transform how real estate transactions are funded and marketed across Australia and New Zealand.

At CampaignAgent, Seth leads a team delivering sophisticated financial technology that enables vendors to access seamless marketing finance while helping agencies optimise cash flow and operational efficiency. The platform has processed over $1.5bn in property marketing transactions, partnering with almost half of Australia’s agencies nationwide.

Seth also serves as Director of Neo/Eastern Press, a specialised print and marketing enterprise servicing the real estate sector with manufacturing facilities in Melbourne and Sydney.

Known for identifying market inefficiencies and developing scalable technology solutions, Seth has established himself as a thought leader in PropTech and FinTech convergence, helping build some of Australia's most recognised real estate brands through strategic partnerships and innovation.

education.degree: Master of Arts (Social Ecology), Community Development, Chaos & Complexity and Human Behaviour
education.field_of_study: Community Development, Chaos & Complexity and Human Behaviour
education.description:
The Master of Education (Social Ecology) explores the dynamic inter-relationships between the personal, social, environmental and ‘spiritual’ domains. We acknowledge that everything we do as individuals affects others; our shared communities and environments. We view ourselves as being parts of the systems (local to global) in which we live, and needing to take responsibility for our roles. Key themes include transformative learning and leadership, applied imagination and creativity, environmental education, social action and advocacy, eco-psychology, eco-spirituality, sense of place and the emergent characteristics of complexity, systemics and ecological thinking.

People develop skills in the areas of environmental education, environmental advocacy, ecological systems, environmental futures, critical and transformative learning and leadership and other areas of interest.

Permaculture is a regenerative design science rooted in the patterns of nature, with practical applications that extend far beyond organic farming into every area of our lives. As a holistic design science, regenerative design is a powerful paradigm of sustainability for governments, businesses, cities, communities and relationships. It is ultimately about maximising the quality of life and health for everyone through smart design focused on maximising sustainable yields.

basic_info.headline: Founder @ ImpulsTrip | Building community through spontaneous travel
basic_info.about:
I’m currently building something that helps people feel more connected in the real world. The idea is still under wraps, but it’s something I truly believe can make a real difference, especially for young people who want to live more in the moment.

As the founder and CEO of an early-stage startup, I’ve been involved in just about everything, from designing the product and figuring out the user experience to building the brand, talking to early users, pitching to investors, and running the day-to-day. It’s been a crazy ride, but also the most meaningful work I’ve done so far.

Before this, I worked in customer-facing roles where I learned how to work with people, stay adaptable, and take initiative. Those lessons have shaped how I lead and build now.

I’m always up for connecting with people who are into building cool things, solving real problems, or just thinking outside the box. If that’s you - let’s chat.

experience.title: Founder & CEO
experience.description:
I started ImpulsTrip with one goal in mind: to help people connect more easily in real life. The idea has been evolving ever since, and I’ve been involved in every part of it.

Right now, I’m leading a small but dedicated team as we build and prepare to launch our first product. I’ve worked on everything from shaping the vision and designing the user experience to building our early community, testing ideas with real users, and prepping for our MVP launch.

Some of the things I’ve been focused on:
	•	Turning early ideas into a working product and prototype
	•	Leading branding, design, and product direction
	•	Talking to users and gathering feedback
	•	Pitching to investors and refining our story
	•	Handling team coordination and daily operations
	•	Keeping everything moving while staying focused on the mission

We’re still in our early phase, but we’re moving fast, and learning a lot along the way. I’m proud of how far we’ve come and excited for what’s ahead.

experience.title: Sales Team Lead
experience.description:
Bentley & Co. was my first real job, and it taught me a lot. I worked closely with customers every day, helping them find what they needed, answering questions, and making sure they had a good experience in-store.

Along the way, I picked up skills I still use today: communicating clearly, thinking on my feet, and staying calm when things get busy. I also got a better understanding of how businesses run behind the scenes and what it means to take ownership of your work.

Looking back, this job helped build the foundation for how I work and lead now.

basic_info.headline: Fieldproof Leader | Field-Tested Leadership for Construction | Creator, Speaker & Founder | In the lab, working on something...
basic_info.about:
Leading a quiet rebellion in construction leadership.

After 11+ years in heavy civil construction, running crews, managing high-pressure jobs, and learning things the hard way, I’ve noticed something:

Most leadership training has no business in construction.

It’s corporate. 
Theoretical.

It sounds good in a boardroom but falls flat on a muddy jobsite.

We teach people how to lay pipe, pour concrete, and operate machinery.

But when it comes to motivating a crew, creating a culture of accountability, or leading under pressure?

Most leaders are left to figure it out on their own. 

Trial by fire.

And that gap shows up in all the usual ways:

- Delays and rework from poor communication
- Stunted productivity and burnout
- Good people walking off the job for good

I’m not claiming to have it all figured out.
But I am building something practical:

A leadership system shaped by real crews, real pressure, and real mistakes.

Not theory. 
Not fluff. 
Just tools that work where you work.

If you’re a foreman, superintendent, project manager, or anyone leading people in the industry: this is for you.

More to come (stay tuned)...

- - - 

In the meantime, here's how you can stay in the loop:

1. FOLLOW ME for daily insights on leading teams in construction. Lessons, stories, and the odd bit of cheekiness - all real, straight from the field.

2. SUBSCRIBE to The Leadership Blueprint newsletter, trusted by industry pros. I share one actionable insider tip a week:

leadershipblueprint.substack.com

3. REACH OUT directly! I’m always open to connect or talk shop:

📩 tariq.shobab@gmail.com 

Let’s build better leaders together.

experience.title: Superintendent
experience.description:
- Superintendent on the 72nd Avenue Connector project ($3M), overlooking the installation of storm and water utilities, road and sidewalk expansion, electrical utilities, paving, and landscaping over two intersections – one on an active highway and the other adjacent to a busy high school  

- Managing comprehensive traffic management plans, work schedules, and phasing plans to lead teams on both day and night shifts, exceeding tight project deadlines and performance goals

- Daily stakeholder management due to proximity to the public, including residents, school faculty and students, as well as client representatives. Continuous coordination with third party utilities, inspectors, and a multitude of subcontractors to ensure project is delivered within schedule and budgetary constraints

experience.title: Superintendent
experience.description:

Managed own forces as well as subcontractors to ensure project is completed within specifications, budget, and on time

- Developed and executed complex work phasing, traffic management, and logistical plans in a congested urban zone, exceeding targets in external quality, safety, and environmental audits

- Cultivated strong relationships with client and stakeholders, resulting in additional work awarded

experience.title: Superintendent
experience.description:
Within 3 months of starting the role, I became the Lead Superintendent for Keller's role in the Westridge Marine Terminals ground improvement project, a $70M venture. Owned by Trans Mountain and administered by KLTP, the project consisted of managing a total of about 60 crew members over both day and night shift performing the following activities:
- jet grouting (3 rigs total including pumps and batch plants)
- pre-drilling / obstruction drilling (1 coring, 1 DTH Hammer, and 1 sonic drill rig)
- vibratory densification / stone columns (1 crane + vibratory probe)

Responsibilities include:
- Safety: ensure work is carried out in accordance to project specific SWP's and the OH&S plan on a project with an extremely high safety standard
- Manpower management: scheduling, mentoring, and leading a 60-member crew over both day and night shift
- Resource management: inventory, procurement, and receiving of materials, parts, and consumables to ensure project does not experience any downtime to production
- Subcontractor management: ensuring subcontractors are scheduled appropriately, perform to expected quality, and adhere to the project specific safety standards
- Develop and drive construction schedule, including KPI tracking and 3-week lookahead schedule
- Collaborate daily with Project Management, Field Engineers, and Safety Team
- Maintain good housekeeping practice both on site as well as with all project records, hard copy and digital

experience.title: Project Engineer, EIT
experience.description:
Project teams were structured in a way that team members fulfilled a complete host of responsibilities. Along with the Project Management Team, I managed the daily on-site operations of the project, including:

- Safety: leading daily toolbox talks, ensuring daily safety paperwork is completed, and that work is carried out in accordance with relevent SWP's, according to the OH&S plan, and Worksafe BC codes
- Quality control: developing and executing QMPs for a variety of civil projects, ensuring adherence to project drawings, municipal codes, and specifications

experience.title: EIT, Project Coordinator
experience.description:
Working with CDI has given me the opportunity to be immersed in all aspects of heavy civil construction - from project procurement and planning all the way through to execution and close-out. Although my official title is Project Coordinator, my role was multi-faceted. As such, some of the functions I am involved in include:

• Project Procurement: create complete estimates and bid packages, interpret technical drawings and specifications, correspond with project owners - RFI's, design changes, budgeting, and scheduling.

• Legal and Contractual: interpret and execute project contracts and subcontracts. Create pre-construction letters of intent, bid packages, and purchase orders. 

• Project Planning: create full project schedules using MS Project, including resource and crew allocation. Create site layout schematics using AutoCAD. Create complete project document organization systems, tracking systems, quality control systems, environmental protection systems, and correspondence protocols. Create site specific environmental, quality, and health and safety procedures.

• Project Execution: coordinate mobilization of crew, equipment, and resources, including coordination with owners, suppliers and subcontractors. Create and maintain project tracking schedule and KPI tracking schedule. Track all project progress including productivity, quantities, and deficiencies. Create regular site reports. Perform quality control and assurance, including video inspections. Ensure all changes to design are technically sound, issue site instructions. Ensure environmental and personal health and safety is maintained. Ensure all site security and clearance is enforced.

projects.name: 2-way Superscalar Out of Order Processor
projects.description:
• Designed 2-way superscalar out of order processor with MIPS R10K style of Register Renaming in SystemVerilog.
• Mainly involved in implementing Load Store Queue (LSQ) with separate LQ, SQ and store to load forwarding, Early Recovery from mispredicted branches using Branch Stack Principle, Reorder Buffer (ROB) and Register Alias Table (RAT).
• Other features include Direct Mapped I-Cache with stride prefetching, victim cache, 2-way set associative non-blocking D-Cache using Miss Status Holding Register (MSHR) and Branch Target Buffer with bimodal branch predictor.

basic_info.headline: LinkedIn Top Voice | MBA Admissions | AI and Machine Learning | Entrepreneurship and Business Development
basic_info.about:
I started my career developing algorithms for optimizing the design of aircraft. Through this, I developed expertise in solving complex nonlinear Partial Differential Equations (Navier Stokes, Structural Dynamics), Optimization, developing high-performance computational algorithms, and writing software to solve these complex problems across millions of data points (FORTRAN, C++, Python, MPI, OpenMP, etc.) I've presented at several high-impact conferences.

The next part of my career was in Corporate Research and Software Development across the Aerospace and Automotive industries. I wrote proposals to obtain funding (up to USD 700K from NASA and the US DoD). I worked in multi-national and multi-cultural teams. I also managed a research relationship with a remotely located team. Through this phase, I developed strength in managing the execution of corporate research projects.

Since 2013, I've bootstrapped a business in education consulting. I helped hundreds of Indian candidates get into global top-20 MBA programs  - including Harvard Business School, MIT, Kellogg, London Business School, INSEAD, ISB, and IIM-Ahmedabad. I coached and mentored about 40 students every year (Engineers from IITs, NITs, and other top-tier Indian colleges, CA's, and other professionals). My students secured an average of US $1.2 Million in scholarships yearly.

From the business point of view, we've had several firsts:

1. Usage of AI and Automation to accelerate work processes (including marketing, sales, financial processes, customer onboarding, appointment scheduling, and project management) in a high-pressure, time-bound, and consultant-time-intensive industry.
2. First to set up an online course platform.
3. First to introduce an ultra-low-cost and distributed consulting model.
4. We are one of the highest-rated Indian consulting firms on GMATclub and Poets and Quants - which are very popular forums amongst MBA applicants.

This resulted in August Academy having healthy profit margins and YoY revenue growth.

I'm now looking to work on intellectually challenging data science problems (Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence) that have the potential to create Scientific and Business Impact.

experience.title: Founder and CEO
experience.description:
August Academy is an MBA admissions consulting company. Since 2013, we’ve helped students belonging to the most competitive MBA applicant pool (Indian Engineers) get into several top 20 schools from across the world. We’ve worked with people in every time zone from Australia to California.

Several of our students have received offers from top 20 schools in the US (including Harvard, Booth, Kellogg, MIT Sloan, Yale, Duke, NYU Stern, UVa Darden, Ross, Cornell, Anderson, UNC Kenan-Flagler, McCombs, Tepper, Olin and Goizueta), top 10 schools in Europe (including London Business School, INSEAD, IMD, HEC Paris, IE, ESADE and Oxford), and top ranked schools in other regions (Rotman, Ivey, Schulich, the National University of Singapore, Indian School of Business and IIM Ahmedabad).

Overall, our students have won about USD 1.2 Million in scholarships every year.

From the business point of view, we've had several firsts:

1. Usage of AI and Automation to accelerate work processes (including marketing, sales, financial processes, customer onboarding, appointment scheduling, and project management) in a high-pressure, time-bound, and consultant-time-intensive industry.
2. First to set up an online course platform.
3. First to introduce an ultra-low-cost and distributed consulting model.
4. We are one of the highest-rated Indian consulting firms on GMATclub and Poets and Quants - which are very popular forums amongst MBA applicants.

This resulted in August Academy having healthy profit margins and YoY revenue growth.
 
https://www.augustacademy.in
https://www.mbaadmissions.augustacademy.in

experience.title: Senior Researcher
experience.description:
I work with the CFD group at General Motors - India Science Lab in Bangalore.  As part of the CFD group, I provide technical expertise to GM Global R&D and GM Engineering for fluid mechanics problems.  Some projects that I am involved in include Shape Optimization for Vehicle Aerodynamics (collaboration with GM HQ in Warren and Stanford University), Virtual Paint Simulations (part of GM's initiative in Virtual Manufacturing) and Battery thermal (heat transfer) problems.

I worked with internal customers to identify technology gaps and guided a small global team of researchers toward research and tool development efforts to address the Virtual Paint simulation problem. Tool developed had the potential to save the company US $ 500,000 to US $ 1 Million per year in license costs.

experience.title: Engineer
experience.description:
Work with a team to develop CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamics) software in C++ and Python.  

The objective is to perform simulations of flow through electronics systems (computer cabinets, cell phones, etc), in order to characterize semi-conductor heating effects, and develop a robust thermal design that can help avoid over-heating.

experience.title: Research Scientist
experience.description:
Was responsible for carrying on Research projects in line with SBIR projects sponsored by the DoD and NASA.

Major Projects:
1) Design of Fluid Actuated Missile Control systems.
2) Developing reduced order models of the US National Airspace based on Queuing Theory.
3) Simulation and Optimization of Airport Surface Traffic.
4) Development of Techniques for Rapid Estimation of Aerodynamic Parameters for Damaged Aircraft.

Wrote many SBIR proposals.  Received Phase I ($100,000) and Phase II ($600,000) funding for Project 4 above.

Other work involved writing proposals for simulation of aero-elastic effects in aircraft, and high performance computation.

basic_info.about:
As the Founder & CEO of NEMA AI, I am passionate about merging neuroscience with artificial intelligence to
create innovative solutions for education and marketing. My mission is to leverage the power of AI to enhance
mental health and provide businesses with actionable insights, ultimately transforming the way we understand
consumer behavior.
I hold US Patent US11600088B2 for our ground-breaking technology and had the privilege of presenting Accenture.

On Shark Tank India Season 3, Episode 41. With a background in neuroscience and AI, I specialize in developing AI-
driven solutions that analyze brain patterns to provide deep consumer insights.

Under my leadership, NEMA AI is backed by esteemed institutions such as iCreate, IIT Mandi, Netapp, and
NASSCOM. My journey began with a fascination for the human brain and its potential to inform AI. Over the years,
I've dedicated my career to exploring this intersection, leading to the creation of NEMA AI.
Outside of work, I am an advocate for mental health awareness and enjoy mentoring aspiring tech innovators. I
invite you to connect with me to explore the future of AI and neuroscience. Together, we can drive innovation and
make a positive impact.

basic_info.headline: Driven by Data, Strategy & Storytelling | Exploring Opportunities in Marketing & Brand Strategy | Co-Founder – Project 52
basic_info.about:
I build experiences that feel like memories.
I’m building Project 52, a brand that curates limited-edition emotional “drops” as pop-ups, rituals, and immersive kits. We don’t sell products. We sell moods, the kind you want to relive. Each drop is part feeling, part fantasy, part escape. People don’t just buy in, they feel seen.
I’ve made films, hosted festivals, and built a relief network from my bedroom during lockdown. It wasn’t perfect, but it was real. And it taught me that if you want people to remember something, you have to make them feel it.
At GlassEye, I served as Vice President, produced 15+ short films, hosted Reverie (our flagship film festival) with its highest-ever turnout, and partnered with sponsors to amplify our work across Delhi NCR. I’ve also worked in marketing strategy at OneXtel (where I was called back as a consultant), and volunteered with nonprofits like Unmukti and The Leaf Society, using digital tools to help optimise outreach.
I’ve represented my school in swimming competitively, and studied Mathematics with a minor in English at the University of Delhi, which means I can write a poem about calculus, and also solve for x.
I’m currently exploring global opportunities in brand strategy, experience design, and emotion-led marketing, with the long-term goal of building brands that people feel, not just follow.

basic_info.headline: Founder & CEO, 1% Club | Forbes 30U30 | Helping India make better financial decisions
basic_info.about:
I am Sharan Hegde, better known as Finance With Sharan.  Actively looking for super smart people to work with me- superdm.com/sharan

With 3.5 million+ subscribers on YouTube and 2.7 million followers on Instagram - you must have seen my entertaining finance videos pop up in your feed, but my LinkedIn is going to tell you a different story. Here I will share my entrepreneurial stories.

With a team of 100+ people, I am going to build my start-up ‘1% Club’ in public.

But before I tell you more, here is a little backstory

It started during my school days when I could not make it to my dream IIT (average Indian household story). That setback made me fiercely competitive. I carried that energy for the next few years of my life.

Fast forward to 2019, I picked up another goal of securing a promotion at my job as a management consultant. Without this promotion, MBA application would look bad. Two years of pure hard work and grind led to a massive 5% increment in salary with no promotion. 

There you go, setback number 2.

Next, I attempted CAT 2021 with the aim of IIM Bangalore in my heart, and if you didn’t see it coming already, this was setback number 3.

I'm sure my story resonates with millions of you guys. So what did I do next? I wrapped up all these learnings, treated failures as feedback, and evolved in an unconventional manner. This is how Finance With Sharan was born.

My mission to spread financial literacy and make it fun for others saw growth in leaps and bounds. Over the last 3 years, I have realized that there is a need to make finance simple and effective, and that is exactly what I am here to do.

Around 2 years back I started The 1% Club. an exclusive members-only community to help people achieve financial independence and become the top 1%. Financial independence is a superpower to never be controlled by money. Less than 1% of people can achieve in their lifetime. Even Kaun Banega Crorepati winners end up bankrupt. Clearly, there is a massive need for us to learn what our schools never taught us and The 1% Club is the solution to this problem.

basic_info.headline: Founder & CEO, Vidhi Sanskaar | Building Something Meaningful Before Graduation | 2X Global Recognition Awardee | Public Speaker
basic_info.about:
I didn’t start with clarity. I started with confusion — noise, pressure to look perfect on LinkedIn, and do what everyone else was doing.

Internships, webinars, workshops — all for a CV that looked great but didn’t feel like me.

But then I found something real.

ADR.
Alternative Dispute Resolution.
A space where you talk before you shout.
Where ego doesn’t win — understanding does.

I’m Anuj.
2nd-year law student.
Not a topper. Not from a big college.
But someone who’s decided to not fake it anymore.

I want to be the kind of lawyer who solves things before they fall apart.

That’s why I’m learning negotiation, mediation, arbitration — and more importantly, how to listen.

My goal?
→ To build a firm that helps people resolve without regret.
→ To help students who don’t want to follow the herd.
→ To grow slow, but real.

I don’t know everything — but I know how it feels to feel lost.
And maybe that’s why I want to create clarity — in law, and in life.

If this feels like something you believe in — let’s talk.
Because courtrooms are loud, but change begins in conversations.

At Microsoft, headed the Microsoft Outlook Products Division in India. At Amazon, drove the Amazon Affiliates Program, and at Honeywell, developed core software for Avionics. At Cropin, envisioned and built the Agri Cloud, scaling it into a multi-million-dollar business.

Not just a product strategist — a Business Transformation Expert. As the Founder of ProductNova, have helped organizations scale 3X faster by blending deep Product, Marketing, and Growth expertise. experience.title: Co-Founder and CEO
experience.description:
Raison is a pioneering AI-First Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) platform in LegalTech — designed to transform how modern organizations manage contracts.

Raison helps businesses navigate complex legal agreements with confidence by leveraging AI that’s personalized to each organization. Raison streamlines contract workflows, assists in co-authoring across internal teams and third parties (customers, vendors, partners, suppliers), and provides intelligent recommendations to minimize risk and accelerate decision-making.

Contracts are at the heart of every business — yet identifying risks, ensuring compliance, and managing negotiations is often manual and error-prone. Raison automates these processes with real-time insights and proactive risk detection, protecting organizations from unfavorable terms and legal blind spots.

Whether you're a legal team in a large enterprise or a founder in a growing startup, Raison acts as your AI legal assistant — enabling efficient drafting, redlining, negotiation, and contract management, all in one seamless platform.

With contracts at the heart of every business, Raison ensures you stay protected, compliant, and in control.

Visit https://raisonclm.com/ for Ai Powered Contract Management

experience.title: Chief Product Officer

I headed the Product Team and the Business Teams @ Cropin. Along with my team, I drove product ideation, design, development, launch; customer-engagement, adoption, scale up; AI/platform innovations at Cropin.

I led a team of experts who drove the revisioning of Agri-Tech and Agri-Intelligence products for B2B and B2C customers across the globe. We worked towards accelerating the farming digitization, convergence of AI/ML, data science, satellite imagery, and remote sensing to re-imagine a truly futuristic tech-enabled agri-ecosystem worldwide. 

I had conceptualized, built and launched the Industry first Agri Intelligence Cloud at Cropin. I enabled position the Cropin Cloud across customers, achieved market fit and drove adoption.

Along with my team, I had also enabled building AI enabled Agri-Intelligence product solutions for the varied personas in the agriculture ecosystem. This has been driving significant transformation across the industry in improving per acre value. 

I built a new Product line for Sustainable Agri Tech and Intelligence.

experience.title: Head of Product - Principal Group Product Manager
experience.description:
I Led the Microsoft Outlook products in India. I led a team of experts redefining the Mail, Calendar and Contacts experiences in Outlook across desktop, browser and mobile. 

I headed the E2E product development and strategy for ‘Outlook mobile web’ and ‘Microsoft Bookings’. I rebuilt the Outlook mobile web experience which has millions of monthly active users and drove 3X growth of users. 

I conceptualized and launched 3 new product lines for Outlook - the Outlook for KaiOS for feature phone users across the world, - the Outlook Lite for developing markets and - the Outlook browser extension in Edge to use Outlook when you are browsing.

Similarly, I had built the Microsoft Bookings app E2E, across Web app, Teams app, mobile apps and API platform, and have launched it for Enterprises and Businesses, driving 18X YOY growth.

I also led a team who worked on improving Outlook Desktop and Outlook platform.

I drive a customer first product approach, understanding user needs via user research, use ‘Jobs-To-Be-Done’ Framework, ‘Diverge and converge’ on user experience concepts based on user testing and build our products by continuous iteration. I built a strong triad driven culture where there is collaborative ideation and product development.

In my past roles at Microsoft,

I owned the Enterprise features for O365 Groups where I conceived and launched premium offerings for O365 collaboration apps, bringing in 5+ million active users. I conceived and launched a new product for groups management in Outlook - The People and Groups Hub, with millions of active users.

For the Windows Universal store, I built the Microsoft affiliates program for Developer Ad monetization, bringing in new customers to Microsoft Store and increasing the store revenue by millions. 

At Microsoft Display Ads team, I conceived a Universal booking tool to book ad campaigns across different Ad engines and across different revenue models CPA, CPC and CPM, with an impact of $5M cost savings.

We want to help you do your life's best work, every single day. 

So we're building Catapult to help make that a reality.

Catapult is personalised to you - understanding all your emails, messages, events, and documents. So, as you work, it anticipates what you'll do next and helps you get it done.

basic_info.headline: CEO & co-founder of LUX Rewards and Lyfe Wellbeing | EntreConf's Fintech of the Year (2024) and Young Entrepreneur (2023) | Insider’s 42under42 | RMI's 30under30 | Hurun's Future Stars | Executive MBA Candidate
basic_info.about:
Resilience, self-belief and relentless optimism. 

Three key characteristics that helped me keep my sanity during the pandemic, which decimated the hospitality sector in which my first venture (LUX Rewards) originally operated. 

In Spring 2021, we re-started in earnest. 
Refreshed and refuelled. 
A new management team. 
A new vision for the business. 

We took what we had built and moved into B2B enterprise. In the following 24 months, we achieved what we hadn't been able to do in the previous 3 years. We grew revenues to over £5million in ARR and now promote card-linked offers to over 105 million payment cards globally, via partnerships with major financial institutions, airlines, employee benefit platforms and reward schemes. 

We are building market-leading rewards scheme technology and solutions. 
B2B focussed. Technology driven. 

We also raised multi-seven-figure investment to fund our growth. 

--------------------------------------------

Achievements:
- RMI 30under30 (Restaurant Marketer & Innovator)
- Hurun's Future Stars
- Top 42 entrepreneurs under 42 by Insider SW
- Multi-seven-figure in equity investment secured throughout the lifetime of the business
- Top Ten Entrepreneurs to Watch in 2017 by #1 Global University Accelerator, SETsquared
- Two time Bath Business Plan competition winner & UoB Dragons' Den winner
- Sparkies Awards: Finalist of the Best App category and James Courtney for FutureSpark award
- Creative Bath Awards: Finalist in the Best App category and James Courtney for Young Creative
- Ten months at IBM working on Social Media Analytics & engaging with innovation days
- Six months at Unilever working on Global Marketing Strategy
- A summer at PwC as a Management Consultant
- A year at Filament as an AI Strategist (product mgmt, strategy consulting & marketing)
- Graduated with a First in BSc. Business at the University of Bath

--------------------------------------------

How it all began: https://www.bath.ac.uk/case-studies/a-rewarding-idea-how-baths-entrepreneurial-spirit-helped-me-launch-my-business/

Alongside achieving a First-class hons in Business Administration, James launched his first venture and became the first student ever to win the Bath Business Plan Competition two years in a row. This gave him the opportunity to travel to New York and SF to meet inspirational Alumni at Facebook, Google, Harvard Business School, Betaworks and various tech startups.

This inspired James to turn down the grad job offers and start his own business. He successfully raised his first investment round during his University studies.

experience.title: Founder & CEO
experience.description:
**LUX has generated over £100,000,000 (yes, one hundred million pounds!) for partnered brands**

LUX Rewards is a key player in the Card-Linked Offers sector. We promote brands to over 105 million payment cards across the UK and US via partnerships with major airlines, banks, employee benefit platforms, cashback sites and premium rewards schemes. 

James founded LUX whilst completing his Business Management degree at the University of Bath, at the age of 21. Using his experience as a management consultant for IBM and PwC, he spotted a gap in the restaurant promotion market for a premium alternative to discounting. He led the business through multiple equity funding rounds, totalling seven-figures and including investment from JUST EAT Plc.

Post-covid, he pivoted the business into the B2B space. This moved LUX away from being a consumer app and now focusses on working in partnership with major airlines and banks. This strategic shift has transformed the business, with revenue growing by over 100x in a 2 year period.

experience.title: Vice President, Investment Risk
experience.description:
Jubilee Investment Team (member of the core investment team which was acquired by Permal) - FoHFs.

As a firm, we were mandated to seek out the best performing (risk adjusted) hedge funds globally, and build a diversified and balanced portfolio allocating c. $8bn, to no more than say, 30 of them. As a member of the investment team, I participated on investment calls, onsite and offsite meetings with leading fund managers and investment analysts, extensive internal discussion and debate regarding some of the world's most well known, established and sometimes even emerging Hedge Funds, across equity, activism, specialist credit, macro and a variety of other niche strategies such as structured credit, stat-arb, merger-arb, short-bias, volatility, commodity and industry specialists.

My role as part of the investment team sat within investment risk and was to focus on risk adjusted performance for invested and prospective funds. Blow up risk, jump risk, market risk, liquidity constraints, were all part of the analysis which fed through to monthly asset allocation and sizing decisions. Much of the work I did looked at whether our managers were appropriately being paid for the risk they were taking, relative to other opportunities which were visible to us in the marketplace. This was an exciting opportunity to decompose leading hedge fund trading strategies to understand the drivers of risk, return and manager thought process behind some of the most exciting, dynamic and best performing global hedge fund's which we were invested in, using position transparency, where available to decompose trades. Decisions were made by marrying our bottom up analysis with our top down macro views of the world.

I engaged with a number of markets and regions, as well as leading industry professionals across the Hedge Fund and Investment Management landscape from London to the USA and Far East, many of whom I continue to remain connected with.

We build timeless brands by not chasing visual appeal and style, but rather honing the full communication of a brand to make sure it is looking, talking and feeling like itself. 

We partner with leaders and founders who are invested  and involved, who want to create or do what’s next not what’s been done, and who are obsessed with quality and innovation. We’ve embedded with teams and worked directly with founders.

I'm a former teacher who taught at The School of Visual Arts MFA and BFA programs as well as at Cornell Tech MBA program. I'm passionate about design education and harnessing the creative process.

Sadly, I'm not related to Alex Katz or Katz's Deli and I own two dogs no cats. If you’re looking for thoughtful design say hello@companypolicy.studio

My driving force is a commitment to creating positive impact. Frecuencia Latinoamérica is a market intelligence company, news organization and B2B conference producer focusing from a business perspective; on the dynamics of the Fintech, crypto, payments, mobile, content, and entertainment app ecosystems in Latin America. As the Region migrates towards digitalization of its services, the company has maintained its status as the leading research and market intelligence provider since its launch more than 25 years ago.

www.frecuenciamobile.com

In early 2012 the company launched Frecuencia Money focusing on the developments in mobile payments, Fintech, commerce, financial inclusion, digital money, and mobile retailing in the Region. The company feeds its coverage from its series of conferences focused on Fintech and financial services in Latin America and the Hispanic US.

www.frecuenciamoney.com

Fintech Summit Latam,  August 24-25, Mexico City, https://fintechsummitlatam.com

In 2020, Lifen launched Lifen Covid, a solution for remotely monitoring COVID-19 patients to help alleviate hospital pressures. Notably, Lifen was included in France's Next40 program in 2022, highlighting its leadership in the health tech sector.

basic_info.headline: CEO & Co-Founder at Simular | Creating autonomous computers | Ex-Google DeepMind Research Scientist | 2x World Finalist Programmer | The future of digital experiences
basic_info.about:
What if your computer could work independently, just like a human assistant?

After a decade in AI research at Google DeepMind, something still deeply puzzled me: we spend 2.5 hours daily just moving our computer mouse. That's 30% of our work time on mechanical tasks.

This realization led me to build Simular AI. We're creating AI agents that use computers like humans do - clicking, typing, and navigating interfaces - so you can focus on what truly matters.

My journey spans:

- Research: 39 papers in top AI venues (NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR, ICLR)
- Engineering: Scaled AI systems at Google (Ads, Maps, YouTube)
- Leadership: Built & led teams in autonomous driving
- Competition: 2x World Finalist in ACM/ICPC

Now, I'm on a mission to democratize AI assistance. Because the future of work isn't about replacing humans - it's about augmenting them.

Want to see the future of human-computer interaction?
→ Visit simular.ai
→ Follow my insights on X @angli_ai

basic_info.headline: Masters Candidate at Columbia University | Founder | Product & Strategy
basic_info.about:
Anmol S Narula is an entrepreneur and innovator with experience in building and scaling ventures that create real impact. He is currently pursuing a Master’s degree at Columbia University, focusing on technology and business to advance transformative solutions.
Anmol is a true generalist with a sharp ability to rapidly grasp complex technical concepts and translate them into practical, market-driven solutions, seamlessly blending technology, marketing, and branding across diverse industries.

As the Founder of Joi Farm, Anmol led the brand to become a market leader in the premium dairy segment in Eastern India within just 24 months. He established both production facilities and a comprehensive go-to-market (GTM) strategy, managing the entire process from manufacturing to market. Joi Farm championed the farm-to-table movement with traceable food products available across all major platforms and chain retail stores. Anmol’s focus on quality, transparency, and innovation redefined the CPG landscape, setting new standards for consumer trust and product innovation.

With a legacy rooted in education, Anmol’s family spans three generations of educationalists. Anmol serves on the board of directors for a university, medical school, and schools, contributing to strategic initiatives and institutional growth. Anmol also led the digital transformation of educational institutions, implementing advanced LMS and admissions platforms to enhance operational efficiency and student engagement.

Anmol has a keen eye for investment opportunities, having driven early-stage investments for the Narula Family Office and the JIS corporate venture fund. Their investment portfolio ranges from edtech to space tech, showcasing a strategic approach to identifying and nurturing high-potential ventures.

Anmol is passionate about exploring opportunities in frontier technology, particularly in health tech, climate tech, and other critical technologies. He thrives on collaborating with innovative teams in New York City and connecting with visionaries who share a drive for creating meaningful, real-world impact.

basic_info.headline: HealthTech Pioneer as Investor and Innovator | Founder and Managing Director @ HealthTech Capital | Mentor Capitalist, Healthcare Strategy Expert | Artist.
basic_info.about:
Anne DeGheest pioneered the HealthTech or Digital Health space as a healthcare executive, an entrepreneur, angel investor, corporate advisor and mentor capitalist. She is the founder of HealthTech Capital and MedStars. She is a recognized leader on how to successfully build innovative HealthTech businesses and change healthcare delivery. 

Since she founded MedStars in 1986, she has been a corporate development advisor to large healthcare companies and a mentor capitalist specializing in investing and mentoring early-stage companies in healthcare. Her life science portfolio companies have generated over $27 billion in market capitalization , including 8 IPOs. She provided angel capital, hands-on operating expertise and/or business strategy in the founding of major venture-backed companies like Pyxis (CareFusion), Aspect Medical (acquired by Covidien), VISX (acquired by AMO), Thermage (merged into Solta Medical), VISICU(acquired by Philips), Masimo (Nasdaq: MASI). She also helped grow new entrepreneurial divisions of large corporations like ASP/Johnson & Johnson, Baxter, Medtronic and McKesson. She was also part of the founding executive team of Nellcor (a division of Covidien), MedPool and OmniCell (Nasdaq: OMCL). She was an Entrepreneur-In-Residence with Canaan Partners and IVP.

Anne founded in 2010 HealthTech Capital, a group of private investors dedicated to funding and mentoring new "HealthTech" startups to decrease healthcare cost and empower patients. HealthTech capital is an ecosystem of angels, venture capitalists, providers, payors and healthcare industry key players with the three sets of expertise needed to succeed in this new HealthTech space: healthcare, technology and user engagement.

Anne is also a recognized artist (www.adegheest.com).  She is a frequent speaker at industry conferences and a guest-lecturer at Stanford Business School.  She has an MBA from Harvard and a master's in business engineering from University of Brussels.

MedStars specializes in working with large corporations and young entrepreneurs in starting and developing disruptive life sciences companies with new innovative and revolutionary products. Our markets include medical devices, healthcare information systems, health related consumer products and biotechnology. 

We have worked with some of the leading medical and biotech companies to help them develop their Healthtech strategy and launch their own breakthrough products. 

 MedStars acts as hands-on mentor capitalist to bring to early stage healthcare companies the financial and business expertise needed to get these start-ups off the ground. We work closely with the entrepreneurs to prove technical and market feasibility, develop sound business models, attract permanent senior management and bring in angel or venture capital financing.

basic_info.headline: Past President Harvard Club of San Francisco, Founder, Master Admissions MBA Consulting, ex-Stanford GSB Leadership Communications Coach
basic_info.about:
Day Job: Founder of Master Admissions, graduate admissions consulting firm, specializing the best business schools in the world. Selected as one of Poets and Quants Top 10 Admissions Consultants 2023 (and also three prior years). 

I have brought many years of capital markets, marketing, and journalism skills on Wall Street, Silicon Valley & Asia to help students meet their goals of getting into their top-choice business schools. I founded Master Admissions in 2009, based also on years of mentoring and coaching aspiring students on their applications to MBA and other graduate programs. I can count 175 admits to Harvard, Stanford, Wharton -- not counting me, who did choose Harvard over Stanford and Wharton. 

Past President of the Harvard Club of San Francisco, which just celebrating its 150th Anniversary. The third largest Harvard alumni club in the world, our club reaches over 25,000 alumni representing 13 schools of the university. 

Other:  Ask me about ice skating and grassroots politics. 

  
MBA Harvard Business School, BA Vassar College 

Specialties: Admissions to best business schools in the world, Leadership communication coaching, MBA admissions, teaching, mentoring, marketing communications, business school advice, admissions essays, brainstorming and editing, resumes, cover letters, finding a narrative

experience.title: Founder & CEO
experience.description:
I've successfully coached 175 Harvard, Stanford, Wharton admits over the years -- and oh my they have gone on to do some amazing things!  These wonderful applicants are are Baker Scholars and Arjay Miller Fellows, they are CEOs of some companies you know and love, or are VC and PE investors funding the same. They have gotten jobs and are now advancing their careers in Asia, Europe, Latin America, and the US. Some are now elected officials, others appointed in city, state and federal government, some work for non-profits and others work for hedge funds.  I couldn't be prouder. 

I started Master Admissions after a long career in the financial markets in sales, marketing and writing/editing, Master Admissions uses a process is designed to help candidates show their own authentic selves in their applications to business school. 

Master Admissions acts as a campaign manager and coach.  We review work and life experiences and carefully elicit the tangible and measurable accomplishments that the applicant may not have recognized as important. If I don't have the expertise in something, I will find someone who does, and we advise you together.  If you need me to introduce you to someone, I'll do that too. 

Also active in the Harvard Club of San Francisco, helped shepherd a club with 25,000 members in the Bay Area into its next 150 years.

basic_info.headline: Building something new
basic_info.about:
I’m Björn Bakker! 👋 I started as a professional race car driver competing with the world's best— then a broken back (+7 other bones) changed everything…

It was a brutal wake-up call, but I channeled my competitive nature, drive, and results-first mindset into building my first company.

By 24, I’d developed specialized nanotech solutions for industrial furnaces, saving manufacturers millions in energy costs and earning my first exit.

That taste of entrepreneurship set the stage for what came next. I realized I had a knack for spotting inefficiencies and solving problems in novel ways.

That’s why I got into tech, and now I've been working in this industry for over a decade (ok almost 2 decades).

I’ve led 3 successful exits, scaled 3 businesses to $100M ARR, and led teams to develop innovative solutions that save companies millions in operational costs.

Today, I'm building something new (currently in stealth). 

Follow my profile if you want to see what's next.

You’ll also find me here sharing thoughts on startup culture, turnarounds, leadership, and my daily rants about life and business—unfiltered, no fluff, just the hard truths and lessons I’ve learned along the way.✌️

education.description:
The altMBA is an online leadership and management workshop. Each session of the workshop is led by a cadre of coaches, who engage with students in individual and group work. Reaching the next level of leadership requires a shift in posture, in decision-making, and, most of all, in choosing to be a linchpin. 
Without guidance, this process can take years of trial-and-error. The altMBA accelerates this personal and professional transformation by providing a deep view of leadership, organizations, and change.

Following a competitive selection process, the altMBA delivers a condensed learning experience through teamwork, personalized feedback, coaching, curated readings, and shipping 13 projects in 4 weeks to take fast-tracked leaders to the next level.

basic_info.headline:
CEO & Co-Founder at Adaptive Security,
Chairman & Co-Founder at Attentive
basic_info.about:
Brian is the CEO and Co-Founder of a Adaptive Security, where we build software to protect companies from new cyber threats like deepfakes, GenAI phishing, smishing and more. Today, Adaptive is growing fast, working with leading businesses like regional and national banks, leading tech and software companies, and critical health systems. 

Brian is also the Co-Founder, Executive Chairman and Board Director at Attentive. 

Under Brian’s leadership, Attentive grew from Brian’s living room to:
- 8,000+ customers and hundreds of millions in annual revenue
- $850+ Million in venture capital raised over 6 financing rounds
- ~1,000 employees with offices all around the world

Attentive has been awarded as:
- Deloitte: The third fastest growing tech company in America (2021) 
- Forbes: Top 10 private cloud companies globally (2022)
- G2: Top 100 Software products in the world (2023)
- Inc: Best Workplaces (2021)

Previously, Brian co-founded and sold TapCommerce to Twitter, where he worked as a Senior Director.  https://techcrunch.com/2014/06/30/twitter-acquires-tapcommerce/

experience.title: CEO & Co-Founder
experience.description:
Stop AI-powered cyber attacks like deepfakes, GenAI phishing, Smishing and More.. 

We have seen a…
- 4X increase in email phishing since the launch of ChatGPT
- 100K+ deepfake attacks in 2024
- 60% of employees will fail a deepfake attack, according to Adaptive estimates. 

Our goal is to reduce that risk by 90%, while also identifying any remaining weak points. 

Adaptive is a Next-Generation Security Training and Simulation Platform. We currently offer two products: Adaptive Phishing and Adaptive Training. 

Adaptive Phishing identifies weak points by simulating GenAI cyber attacks over email, SMS, chat, and voice. Businesses can customize these attacks to utilize features like deepfakes of their executive team, open source intelligence of their company, and known attack vectors. 

Adaptive Training educates employees on new and emerging security threats like deepfakes, smishing, and social media attacks. Material is broken down into engaging 3-7 minute modules, optimized for mobile and desktop viewing. Content is automatically personalized for every business. 

Today, Adaptive is growing fast, working with leading businesses like regional and national banks, leading tech and software companies, and critical health systems. 

Adaptive’s mission is to protect people and businesses from AI-powered cyber attacks. Over the next decade, we will work tirelessly to stay one step ahead of attackers with enhanced features, new products, and scale to every business globally.

basic_info.headline: Founder & CEO @ Percy, Delivering better insights for a better night's sleep | Board Certified Behavior Analyst | MS, Behavioral Psych | MBA | Author | MassChallenge 2023 | MIT Dual-Use Venture Incubator | HatchFairhope
basic_info.about:
As a board certified behavior analyst, author, and leading children’s sleep consultant, I know that every great journey starts with a good night's sleep. I founded Percy to revolutionize how families and healthcare providers use behavioral data to create lasting and transformative change in this vital area of our lives.

From my background as an Intelligence Officer and Major in the US Air Force, to my lived experience as mother of four children, I bring focus and stamina to solving problems. My MS in Behavioral Psychology and board certification as a BCBA inform a rigorous and evidence-based approach to sleep behavior change. And my MBA from Kellogg has helped me translate my unique perspective and expertise into a market-changing business proposition.

For much of the last two decades, I’ve run a pioneering sleep consultancy, Dream Team Baby, with my business partner, Kira Ryan. Together, we launched the first overnight sleep consultancy in Manhattan–an offering that paved the way for what has become a $40M sleep consultant industry. Our work was featured in major media outlets including The Today Show, Good Morning America, and Nightline, The CBS Early Show, ParentsTV, Washingtonian Magazine, American Baby, Fatherly, and New York Family, among others. Our book, The Dream Sleeper: A Three-Part Plan for Getting Your Baby to Love Sleep (Jossey-Bass, Inc., 2012) documents our methodology and helps parents and children form healthy sleep behaviors, which leads to a love of sleep. 

With the launch of Percy, I’m bringing the full scope of my experience to the table to create a new dawn in sleep technology. We are still in stealth-mode, but will provide updates as we refine our product. Please join our journey at percysleep.com.

*** Building something new. Legal x Tech ***

Dan Mishin is the founder of June Homes - a leading technology platform for the flexible living category, and Co-Founder of NextStory Capital - a modern-day multi-family real estate investment fund. 

We use software to make the apartment renting experience more flexible, simple, and digital for the new generation of renters.

June has raised over $70M+ of capital from world-class investors, including SoftBank, Nomura, Quiet Capital, FJ Labs, TQ Ventures, PnP Ventures, Scott Belsky, Demi Lovato, Scooter Braun, and others. 

We are on a mission to build a global market leader in flexible housing, expanding quickly ($1.3 Billion of Assets Under Management, $54M of ARR, 250 team members, EBITDA positive, 70% growth YoY). 

Before June Homes, Mishin founded Bear Hostels, a leading hostel company in the CIS region. In 2012, Bear Hostels was majority acquired by Planet of Hospitality Holdings, the largest hospitality company in Eastern Europe. 

Following a $100M investment announcement, Dan became the CEO of the Joined Venture and led expansion across multiple markets in the CIS region until exiting the company in late 2015. 

Mishin has been featured in Forbes, Fox News, INC., CNBC, Entrepreneur, Business Insider, TechCrunch, Crains, The Real Deal, and many other media outlets.

Dan has been recognized as TOP 5 student entrepreneurs in the World by the Entrepreneurs Organization (2012, New York Stock Exchange), Crain's Notable in Real Estate list (2022, NYC), and 30 Under 30 by Forbes.

basic_info.headline: Co-Founder & CEO at Hayle inc.
basic_info.about:
David is an entrepreneur and tech industry leader who founded and currently leads Hayle Inc.

In August 2018, Hayle launched a mobile social networking application enabling users to connect with local people based on their shared interests. Unlike other social media platforms, Hayle is focused on creating meaningful connections and addressing the problem of social isolation. David and his team worked tirelessly to refine and improve the application, testing various iterations in different cities, until they found the perfect formula to create stronger friendships and healthier relationships.

After leaving Hayle in October 2018 to better understand the tech industry in California, David returned to Ottawa in December 2018. He quickly identified the growing demand for home renovations and the potential for technology to support this trend. In January 2019, David began exploring opportunities in the stone industry, working with a granite and marble distribution company and witnessing the potential for technology solutions in this space.

In April 2020, David formed a joint partnership with TSF - The Stone Fabricator Inc., a countertop fabrication company, to leverage the latest web technologies to assist the growing demand for home renovations. David played a key role in redesigning and developing TSF's website into a sophisticated web application, complete with a customer relationship management system, online inventory, and loyalty program to entice B2B customers.

After rejoining Hayle in April 2021 as Chief Executive Officer, David led a complete rebranding of the company, detaching the name "Hayle" from the mobile application and establishing it as their official business name. Due to the pandemic, he pivoted the company towards creative services, designing and developing web applications, mobile applications, and software for various industries and government bodies.

In October 2022, David launched a new project called StoneForge by Hayle Inc., a web application for stone fabricators to manage their business from A to Z. David's experience, vision, and expertise in developing technology solutions have enabled him to create innovative solutions that drive measurable business outcomes and help his clients stay ahead of the curve in a rapidly changing digital landscape.

experience.title: Co-Founder & CEO
experience.description: David led a complete rebranding of the company, separating the name "Hayle" from its mobile application and establishing it as the official business name. In response to the pandemic, he shifted the focus of the company from the mobile application to Creative Services, a strategic move that enabled Hayle Inc to thrive during the Sars-Cov-2 pandemic. Currently, Hayle specializes in developing cutting-edge web and mobile applications as well as software solutions for various industries, including construction, medical, and food.

experience.title: Business Development Officer
experience.description:
David was instrumental in modernizing the company’s digital infrastructure and expanding its market reach. He led the transformation of the company’s website into a fully functional web application, developed in collaboration with Hayle Inc., enhancing both user experience and operational efficiency. In addition, David designed and implemented a custom CRM, online inventory system, and a B2B loyalty program, allowing TSF to better understand and retain its commercial clients—ultimately increasing sales and long-term partnerships.

Over a six-year span, David helped foster and secure over $4 million in accounts and contracts on countertop fabrication, contributing significantly to the company’s growth. Following 2023, he worked closely with the board of directors to diversify operations, introducing renovation services and expanding into real estate investment and development. His focus shifted toward multi-family housing projects and job creation within Ottawa’s construction sector. David also began engaging directly with overseas suppliers, learning about emerging technologies and materials to help innovate Ottawa’s construction industry—bridging global resources with local needs to create sustainable, future-ready development opportunities.

experience.title: Co-Founder & CEO
experience.description:
In August 2018, Hayle launched a social networking mobile application designed to connect users with local people who share similar interests. Unlike other platforms that prioritize popularity contests or hookup culture, Hayle's focus is on solving the pervasive issue of social isolation. By emphasizing mutual interests over age or gender, Hayle facilitates connections that lead to stronger friendships and healthier relationships built on common ground. With Hayle, users can build meaningful connections with like-minded individuals.

Using advanced algorithms, Hayle finds matches beyond age and gender. The app focuses solely on mutual interests, ensuring that users are connected with individuals who share a common ground. This approach fosters a sense of community and belonging, and helps users build lasting relationships that are based on shared passions and interests.

Hayle is a powerful tool for anyone who feels isolated or disconnected from the people around them. By providing a platform for connecting with like-minded individuals, Hayle offers a solution to one of the biggest problems facing society today. Whether you're new to town, looking for a change of pace, or simply seeking to expand your social circle, Hayle can help you make meaningful connections that enrich your life.

experience.title: Assistant Member of Parliament
experience.description:
David served as an Assistant to several Member of Parliament representing ridings in Ottawa, where he was actively involved in shaping and supporting progressive legislative initiatives. He contributed to efforts around youth homelessness, including support for bill proposals aimed at improving access to federal funding, transitional housing, and education programs for at-risk youth.

He fostered national conversations around Basic Income, advocating for a model inspired by the Ontario Basic Income Pilot—where Canadians earning under $40,000 annually receive direct support, and those earning above $120,000 contribute more. David also took a firm public stance against Bill C-51, championing civil liberties and rallying communities concerned with government overreach and surveillance.

Beyond policy work, David has been a visible advocate in media and public events. He has spoken at University of Ottawa guest lectures, and appeared on Global News, CBC, CTV, and WE Day, sharing his insights and experiences to raise awareness on homeless youth, Indigenous equity, and social justice.

David’s advocacy extended to Indigenous communities, particularly the Cree in Quebec, where he championed clean water access and the development of trades-based education programs to foster long-term opportunity. His journey and impact were also featured in a TEDx talk, where he reflected on the power of policy, public voice, and inclusive change.

I’m passionate about creating at the intersections of human experience and scientific breakthroughs. Since studying Materials Science at Stanford, I’ve been working on a new biotech venture to revolutionize the way that we take medicine. 

Growing up, I always loved dreaming about novel technologies but I didn’t see myself as a scientist. I was incredibly fortunate to find mentors once at Stanford that led me down this path. The whole time, I've been focused mostly on two areas - health and climate - as both allow me to channel technology into improving people’s lives. 

For now though, I’m wholeheartedly focused on how we can re-design pharmaceutical products and our relationship to health. I believe that taking a holistic approach, and taking responsibility for the user experience and design of each element of what we build is necessary to create real change. 

Feel free to reach out to me to discuss anything materials / nano science / biotech, healthcare, or women in STEM.

basic_info.headline: Founder & Managing Partner | Driving AI Innovation in Healthcare | Investor in Health-Tech Companies
basic_info.about:
I’m deeply committed to transforming healthcare through the responsible use of AI and advanced technology. My work centers on building scalable, impactful solutions that improve patient outcomes, support healthcare professionals, and modernize the care ecosystem. 

My journey began after seeing the effects of misdiagnosis within my own family, an experience that led to a lifelong mission to make healthcare safer, smarter, and more humane. That mission guided me from founding and selling an AI startup to now shaping strategic growth efforts at the intersection of AI, data, and healthcare innovation.

Our focus is global. Our approach is collaborative. And our vision is bold: a healthcare system where technology works for everyone: patients, providers, and innovators alike. 

Let’s connect if you're working on something that can change the world, or if you want to be part of one that is.

I am passionate about startups, venture capital and technology. My professional career has been a journey through innovation and problem solving within organizations in which I have played an "Intrapreneur" role, that is, I am not limited to a single role. I have worked in different areas and many times I have served as the bridge that connects teams, ensuring that everything flows towards a common goal.

I consider myself a curious person with a "make things happen" mentality. I don't always have all the answers or skills from the start, but my proactivity and autonomy drive me to find effective solutions, whatever the challenge.

I mainly work in growth, product and business development roles. In addition, I spend time building community and generating opportunities for those around me, building long-term relationships that enhance the entrepreneurial ecosystem. 

If you share these passions or are looking for someone with a dynamic and results-oriented approach, let's connect!

basic_info.headline: 2x Founder, AIA, NCARB, ARB, TEE-TCG
basic_info.about:
Georgios Kontominas is a licensed architect (US, UK, GR) operating at the intersection of Architecture and Artificial Intelligence. He is the CEO and Co-Founder of a venture-backed AI construction tech startup based in San Francisco, currently in stealth.

Previously, Georgios co-founded and served as Director of Architecture at Pantheon AI, an AI-enabled architecture firm backed by a16z, 8VC, Felicis, and angel investors. Throughout his career, Georgios has collaborated with prominent architecture firms such as WRNS Studio and SOM in San Francisco, and SPARCH Sakellaridou/Papanikolaou Architects in Thessaloniki, Greece, where he led a wide range of projects from schematic design to completion, across various scales and sectors.

He holds a Diploma in Architectural Engineering (Dipl-Ing) from Aristotle University of Thessaloniki, where he graduated Summa Cum Laude and was Valedictorian. Georgios furthered his education with a Master’s degree from UC Berkeley’s College of Environmental Design, graduating with Distinction. During his time at Berkeley, he received multiple merit-based scholarships, including recognition as a Gerondelis Foundation Scholar and a Stavros Niarchos Foundation awardee, while also working as a Graduate Student Researcher concentrating on Additive Manufacturing, Bio-inspired Design and Digital Fabrication.

Georgios’ work has been exhibited internationally in Greece, Cyprus, Spain, the UK, China, and the U.S., and he has been nominated for prestigious awards, including the EU Mies van der Rohe Award (2024 nominee with SPARCH Architects for the American Elementary School of Thessaloniki, "Anatolia").

basic_info.about:
Grant is a founder and strategic product, growth, and BD/partnerships leader, with 15 years of diverse international experience.

Grant is the founder of AMID, an AI focused incubator/accelerator in San Francisco. In 2024, AMID supported over 75 top founders through a 3-month in person Founder Fellowship. 

Past: In 2016, Grant co-founded the “Giphy of China”, Dongtu Yuzhou, powering 800m daily content searches. Grant has also held senior executive roles at Koji ($36m funding, acquired by LinkTree), Swyft Media (acquired 2015 by Monotype) and consulted or advised numerous other tech startups in the USA and abroad.

Grant has led the growth of products achieving billions of monthly users, the development of complex API/SDK ecosystems along with over 80 native mobile applications, and personally negotiated and closed over 100 partnerships, licenses, and commercial deals with companies in entertainment, technology, and advertising industries including Facebook, Microsoft, Samsung, Apple, HTC, The Pokemon Company, Viacom, Tencent, Kakao, Viber, the National Football League, WWE. 

Grant also enjoys mentoring the next generation about the future of media, communication, entrepreneurship, and sharing his experiences as an American building a startup in China. Recent talks include: UPenn Wharton MBA, RISE Conference, USC School of Cinematic Arts, Peking Guanghua Business School, and the Roski School of Fine Art & Design.

Trifecta is the nations largest organic meal delivery service, and ships millions of meals to all 50 states. Our team sources fresh, organic ingredients, and then cooks and ships them for deliveries nationwide. 

Recent studies have pointed to convenience as the #1 reason American's are overweight, above education, poverty, and all other factors. (http://www.forbes.com/sites/bethhoffman/2012/07/17/its-convenience-not-cost-that-makes-us-fat/)

Our company mission is to get America back into shape, and eventually to fundamentally change the food supply chain to improve animal welfare, reduce shipping costs, and eliminate all packaging.

How Trifecta Works:

You live a busy life, and making eating healthy day in and day out, every meal of the day, extremely difficult. Instead of grocery shopping, cooking, washing dishes, or spending hundreds eating out, Trifecta buys the highest quality Organic ingredients available on the market, our chefs cook them to perfection, and we delivery them directly to your door.

Our meals are never frozen, and are vacuum sealed immediately after being made, chilled overnight in our walk in fridges, and sent Fedex Next Day Air directly to your door. We offer free shipping to all 50 states, and our meals are perfectly macronutrient balanced so you can eat healthier than you ever have before in your life, easier than you ever have before in your life.

experience.title: Founder / CEO
experience.description:
Amara was a first of it's kind Sports / Energy drink designed to displace high sugar, low quality ingredient sports and energy drinks like Gatorade and Rockstar. 

Amara was scaled to over 1,000 retailers including Whole Foods, BevMo, Total Wine, Raley's, and many more while managing a large e-commerce presence that drop most of the brands growth and visibility. The brand secured partnerships with CrossFit, The Paleo Diet, and over 50 celebrity athletes and influencers/creators that helped spread wide visibility of the brand across all marketing channels.

This was my first foray out of the software world and into the CPG / e-Commerce world. Ultimately it lead to the launch of Trifecta via the partnership with The Paleo Diet. Within 5 months of launching Trifecta as a sister company, Trifecta grew so quickly that it outstripped Amara's 5 year ARR and the investor group and leadership team decided to roll Amara's shareholder base into Trifecta and focus on Trifecta as the core business.

basic_info.headline: Builder and Product Leader | ex-Amazon
basic_info.about:
My passion and superpower is bringing new ideas to life. I’m an entrepreneurial product and business leader particularly interested in applying AI/ML to solve really big problems. 

There’s nothing I love more than bringing together a group of talented people and working on something ambitious together. I thrive in fast-paced environments with high standards and in roles that require constant learning, creative thinking, leadership, and action. 

I’m personally and professionally interested in Climate Change, the Future of Work, Healthcare, and how advances in LLMs and other AI systems can help us build a cleaner, healthier world for the generations that come after us.

Some of the things I love doing and am really good at:
- Figuring out how to get from 0 to 1 on new ideas and thinking critically about the “Whys?”
- Crafting a meaningful vision to attract talented people and align our efforts
- Creating high-performing, psychologically safe environments for superstars to collaborate and do  their best work in
- Being a servant / egoless leader
- Working alongside the team as a peer in whatever capacity is most needed (this gives me energy)

The thread throughout my career has been using technology to solve problems, with a particular interest in applied ML/AI. I think some of my most formative experiences were as an end user of state-of-the-art AI systems at Amazon a decade ago, seeing how profoundly applied ML can create competitive advantages. 

For the next part of my career, I’m dedicating myself to using emerging AI technologies to solve pressing problems in the Jobs, Climate, Financial, and Healthcare spaces.

basic_info.headline: CEO and Co-Founder @ CanaSale | MBA
basic_info.about:
Welcome to my LinkedIn profile! 

I am a visionary entrepreneur and avid venture capital enthusiast with a strong passion for technology and startups. With a track record of launching and scaling successful ventures, I thrive on turning cutting-edge tech ideas into reality.

Innovation-Driven Leadership:
As the Founder and CEO of a dynamic software company, I have a deep-seated commitment to driving innovation in the tech industry. I lead my team with an entrepreneurial spirit, fostering a culture of creativity and continuous learning. Our software solutions not only address complex challenges but also elevate businesses to new heights of efficiency and growth.

Serial Entrepreneurial Success:
Having launched and scaled multiple startups to fruition, I understand the unique challenges and exhilarating rewards that come with entrepreneurship. From ideation to execution, I've navigated the startup landscape with determination, adaptability, and resilience. My diverse experiences have forged my passion for supporting and empowering fellow entrepreneurs on their journeys.

Venture Capital Enthusiast:
As a seasoned entrepreneur, I am deeply immersed in the world of venture capital. I actively engage with and invest in promising early-stage startups, empowering them with the resources and guidance they need to thrive. I firmly believe in fostering a collaborative ecosystem where bold ideas flourish and transformative technologies emerge.

Let's Collaborate!
I'm always excited to connect with like-minded individuals who share a passion for technology, startups, and venture capital. Whether you have a groundbreaking tech idea to discuss, seek advice on scaling your startup, or want to explore potential investment opportunities, I'm all ears! Let's spark innovation and create meaningful impact together.

Feel free to reach out for a chat or connect with me to stay updated on my latest ventures, industry insights, and upcoming tech collaborations. Together, we can make a difference in the world of technology and beyond!
