basic_info.headline: AI Security Leader Palo Alto Networks. 3x Founder w/ 3 Exits. Prior Worldwide Leader AI & ML at Amazon and VP Machine Learning at Oracle.
basic_info.about:
CEO of Co Founder of Protect AI - Security for ML Systems and AI Applications. 

Prior to Protect AI, Swanson was the Amazon Web Services Worldwide Leader for Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.

Prior to Amazon, Vice President of Machine Learning at Oracle. In this role, Ian oversaw the strategy for Oracle’s Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning products. 

Prior to Oracle, Swanson was CEO and Founder of DataScience.com which was acquired by Oracle May 2018. DataScience.com provided an industry leading enterprise data science platform that combined the tools, libraries, and languages data scientists loved with the infrastructure and workflows their organizations needed. 

Earlier in his career, Swanson was an executive at American Express, Sprint, and CEO of Sometrics. Sometrics launched the industry's first global virtual currency platform in 2008 and was acquired by American Express in 2011. That platform -- for which he earned a patent -- managed more than 3.3 trillion units of virtual currency and served an online audience of 250 million in more than 180 countries.

A sought-after speaker and expert on digital transformation, data science, big data and performance-based analytics, Swanson actively advises Fortune 500 companies and invests in leading start-ups.

Amazon CloudSearch:

experience.title: Teaching Team, The Future of Cities: Entrepreneurship, Policy & Business Strategy
experience.description:
Cities are where billions of people live and are engines for innovation and economic growth. They are also going through enormous change and battling with fundamental issues related to housing, transportation, urban planning, the environment, safety, transparency and more. Innovation offers the promise of exciting solutions. But for that change to happen, it must serve the interests of the people who live in cities and overcome the challenges of politics and policymaking. 

Our course focuses on this intersection. We analyze cities as a distinct phenomenon, look at what is possible technologically, and explore how change can be brought about. Offered by the Political Economy group at the Graduate School of Business.

My coursework focused on tech-enabled innovation, product management, data-driven decision making, and core business competencies across finance, strategy and management. 

More critical than what I learned about business at the GSB is all that I learned about myself, largely thanks to coursework in interpersonal dynamics, coaching, and values-driven leadership.

My coursework, completed across the Medill School of Journalism and the Kellogg School of Management, blended the art and science of marketing. I focused on analytics and consumer insight, and was lucky to study abroad at University of London and Universidad Diego Portales in Santiago, Chile.

basic_info.headline: 3x founder building AI Design Teammates | Prev: Hellosaurus (YC S20, acq), HQ Trivia, Google, Stanford GSB, Harvard, Forbes 30u30
basic_info.about:
An award-winning founder, CEO, and product leader, James has spent over a decade collaborating with friends to turn ideas in their heads into products enjoyed by tens of millions of people and generating tens of millions in revenue.  

James is once again starting something new, exploring building autonomous AI product teams, starting with product design agents.

As Head of Product at Pika, James built leading generative AI video foundational models and video creation tools used by millions. Before Pika, he was the founder and CEO of Hellosaurus (YC S20), an interactive EdTech platform for preschoolers that ranked as high as the #3 App For Kids on the Apple App Store before successfully exiting to Brilliant.org. Before Hellosaurus, James helped start and led all product management, ideation, and engineering of HQ Trivia, a network of live trivia game shows that he helped grow from prototypes into international phenomena. He began his career as an APM at Google. He holds an Economics and Computer Science degree from Harvard College, holds an MBA from the Stanford GSB, and was named Forbes 30 Under 30.

Soon, Remy will evolve into an autonomous teammate for any design task and, eventually, into a fully agentic product team capable of automatically ideating, designing, and shipping optimal software.

Look around. If your company isn't led as much by inclusion as it is by the bottom line, then it will fail at both.

Let's change the world together.

Communicate complex insights through peer-reviewed publications and accessible infographics. Illustrative client outcomes include:

	•	UNICEF | Multiple Consultancies | 2017–2023: Convened two high-level stakeholder dialogues shaping Syria’s education coordination strategy, benefitting nearly 4 million children. experience.title: Project Team Lead
experience.description:
I am leading a team to improve non-formal education service provision for conflict-affected children and youth in Sudan. Working with donors and implementing partners, we are creating school-age learner profiles, mapping current non-formal education offerings, analysing the degree to which the offerings are responsive to the learner profiles as well as quality standards, and recommending modifications to improve service quality, delivery, and uptake.

This project is part of the FCDO-funded Scaling Access and Learning in Education (SCALE) programme, focused on improving foundational learning outcomes in low- and middle-income countries. It aims to increase the uptake of cost-effective interventions through a "test-learn-adapt" approach, leveraging evidence-based practices and implementation science.

basic_info.headline: Powering the future of digital entrepreneurs | Founder & CEO ChannelCore | CMO Alliance CMO to watch 2024 | Scaled brands north of $1.2 billion in revenue |
basic_info.about:
ChannelCore started as a marketing agency, built to help brands scale profitably. But after working closely with both content creators and brands, it became clear there was a bigger opportunity, to build the infrastructure the creator economy truly needs.

That’s why ChannelCore is evolving to a tech platform designed to help content creators run their businesses like businesses - scalable, profitable, and built for the long term.

My journey to this point has been anything but traditional. I started as a music teacher and later became a touring musician, where I learned the power of creativity, discipline, and connection. Those experiences taught me how to perform under pressure, adapt quickly, and lead with purpose.

When I transitioned into marketing, I quickly made an impact leading teams, driving revenue growth, and building scalable systems. I rose through the ranks to become a 2x CMO, leading marketing strategies that scaled brands from $1.5M to $6M, $16M to $31M, $64M to $200M, and even $750M to $1.2B. In 2024, I was recognized as a CMO to Watch by the CMO Alliance, a testament to the results-driven approach and leadership style that define my career.

Over the last 17 years, I’ve led, built, and scaled marketing teams of 30+, managed $75M+ in ad spend, and owned full P&L responsibility all focused on profitable, sustainable growth.

My work spans global brands and fast-growing startups, with results like:

• Luxury Fashion Brand: Scaled to a successful exit

• DTC Apparel: 4.5X ROAS while reducing CAC by 38%

• CPG Brand: Tripled new customer revenue, boosted LTV by 60%

• Fintech Startup: Increased lead conversion by 240%, reduced CPA by 45%

• Financial Services Firm: Built a scalable customer acquisition strategy that doubled inbound leads

Now, with ChannelCore’s evolution, we’re building something bigger designed for the next generation of content creators and brands ready to scale.

⚡Check out more at https://channelcore.io

More soon.

experience.title: Founder & CEO
experience.description:
ChannelCore exists to make creativity economically viable.

We believe the people who power the internet - content creators - should be able to earn a fair, predictable living from their work, and brands should be able to invest in that creativity with the same accountability they expect from any performance channel.

Everything we build is driven by that purpose: to turn passion into sustainable businesses and transform influencer marketing into a transparent, data-driven growth engine for everyone involved.

I founded Bossa Nova Solutions because I’m passionate about turning innovative ideas into impactful products. With a natural talent for design and a sharp eye for strategic thinking, I recognized an opportunity to provide software solutions that empower others to bring their visions to life.

Starting this journey wasn’t just about creating a business—it was about building something meaningful. I wanted to use my expertise and creativity to help clients transform their ideas into tangible, innovative products. To achieve this, I assembled an amazing team of talented individuals who share my dedication to quality, collaboration, and growth.

Something especially important to me is fostering a workplace where people genuinely enjoy coming to work. I’ve worked hard to create a friendly, respectful, and supportive environment where team members feel valued and empowered to take responsibility while working together toward shared goals.

At Bossa Nova Solutions, I’m driven by the belief that great design, well crafted technology and smart strategy go hand in hand, and I work every day to ensure our solutions reflect those principles. My role allows me to combine my skills in client relationships, strategic planning, and team leadership to create value for both our clients and the company.

When I’m not managing projects or brainstorming new ideas, I’m focused on future planning—envisioning how Bossa Nova Solutions can continue to evolve, innovate, and exceed expectations.

basic_info.headline: CEO/Founder, Product Leader, Board Member
basic_info.about:
I am the founder and CEO of illumyn and illumyn Impact (f/k/a Him For Her,) two social impact ventures who share the mission of diversifying the board ecosystem. Since its founding in 2018, illumyn Impact (formerly known as Him For Her) makes highly-curated introductions that bring fresh, experienced talent into the board ecosystem. It has partnered with 100+ global venture capital and private equity firms and made thousands of introductions landing new voices in the boardroom. Partner company illumyn unlocks board visibility, opportunity, and access for top leaders at large corporations who are looking to board service as a path to retention, development, and career growth. 

I currently serve as an independent director on the boards of Wag! (NASDAQ: PET) where I am Lead Director and Compensation Chair, Papa John’s International (NASDAQ:PZZA) where I am a member of the Compensation and Nominating and Governance Committees, and ChowNow, where I am Compensation Chair. I am an advisor to Homebase and a part-time moderator with Netflix Leadership Programs. 

As a product technology executive with over 20 years experience building iconic global products for CitySearch, Ticketmaster, OpenTable and Snagajob, I focus on what the technology is doing for the business. I believe in a broad application of design and design thinking particularly applied to organizational development and inclusive of cross-functional teams. 

My leadership methodology is rooted in the real world. I build organizations that foster collaboration and accountability together. I have a track record of injecting creativity into organizations by recognizing other people’s superpowers and putting them in positions to optimize them. I hire people who will push us forward. 

I am a member of the 2016 class of Henry Crown Fellows at the Aspen Institute and a TEDx speaker. 

As a business leader, entrepreneur and mother of two, I advocate that work and family can thrive together.

basic_info.headline: Co-founder and CEO of Stealth Startup
basic_info.about:
My entire career has been geared towards leading edge technologies and is unique in that it encompasses:

•	Startup creation
•	Technology forecasting 
•	Socio-economic analysis
•	Financial analysis
•	Product planning 
•	Implementation of different design approaches
•	Systems analysis
•	Operational analysis 
•	Industry analysis and market analysis
•	Invention and innovation
•	University technology transfer

I have analyzed, forecasted, and developed business cases for: information technology, biotechnology, telecommunications systems, artificial intelligence and robotics, space launch systems, magnetically levitated trains, factory automation, desalination, weapons systems, sensor systems, space solar power, as well as conventional fossil and renewable energy technologies.

In addition, I have mentored over 150 startups in multiple industries, as well as managed entrepreneurship programs at high technology and biotechnology incubators.  I was also the founder FastForward at the Johns Hopkins University.  FastForward is the incubator and mentoring network of Johns Hopkins.  I also managed a portfolio of over 500 patents, making patenting decisions based on my understanding of markets for emerging technologies.

My unique background allows me to look at technology opportunities from many different perspectives and apply unique approaches to building products and business plans.  I have also received a patent and I am currently working on other inventions.

I remain very interested in leading edge technologies and cutting edge approaches to developing them.  I recently relocated to Carlsbad, CA and am working on a stealth startup as well as advising other startups.  More updates soon on other developments.  For career details, see my employment history below.

experience.title: Senior Director, Commercialization Strategy Group, Johns Hopkins Technology Ventures
experience.description: This was a newly created position.  I was responsible for technology commercialization initiatives related to intellectual property across the university.  In addition, the Commercialization Strategy Group manages three translation venture funds, and conducts patent analysis, market analysis, as well as technical analysis on university inventions.

experience.title: Director, Homewood Intellectual Property Office
experience.description:
Homewood Intellectual Property Office (Homewood IP) managed the intellectual property portfolio and commercialization initiatives for the Whiting School of Engineering (WSE), and the Zanvyl Krieger School of Arts & Sciences (KSAS).  I was responsible for setting the strategic direction of the intellectual property portfolio, supervising the intellectual property docket, reviewing sponsored research agreements, controlling the budget, as well as managing staff.  I was also member of the Conflict Review Committee for the Whiting School of Engineering (WSE), and the Zanvyl Krieger School of Arts & Sciences (KSAS).

Founding Director of the FastForward Innovations, created to jump-start startup creation at JHU.   FastForward operates two accelerators and provides active mentoring support to startups.

experience.title: Founder
experience.description: Consulted to a venture capital group to develop new approaches to investing in emerging technologies.  Scope of work included developing internal product evaluation mechanisms and surveying new industry models for venture acceleration.

experience.title: Vice President for Entrepreneurial Services
experience.description:
Manager of entrepreneurial services for large high technology incubator cluster.  Mentored 125 very early stage high technology and biotechnology companies.  These companies have raised over $100 million in private equity, 88% were still in business after five years, and employ over 750 people. 

Authored Key Success Factors for Building High A High-Technology Start-up to guide early stage technology companies.  Presented guide at the 2005 National Business Incubation Association convention. 

Created the Intensive Incubation Initiative to accelerate the development of a select group of very early stage high technology and biotechnology companies commercializing inventions developed in universities. 

Advised Johns Hopkins University and NASA on technology commercialization, venture creation and technology licensing.  Assessed technology portfolios slated for licensing for NASA.

Guest Lecturer on innovation management at the University of Baltimore and Loyola MBA programs.

experience.title: Senior Associate
experience.description:
Case Manager for consulting firm specializing in managing complex, technology-based development programs.  Lead consultant for technology forecasting, technology assessment and technology diffusion.  

Consulted to NASA, National Maglev Initiative, Ballistic Missile Defense Organization, the Department of the Navy, and to a private company developing Independent Power Projects in Mexico.

Member of a NASA Senior Advisory Board chartered to conduct an independent economic and market forecast of the international energy market in the 2025 time-frame for the Space Solar Power Program.  Authored long-range forecast on the market for renewable energy and long term energy trends for the Senior Advisory Board.

Served as an expert witness at a Congressional Hearing and at a National Academy of Sciences review panel on findings of Space Solar Power Advisory Board.

Principal Investigator for the development of technology roadmaps for three NASA programs.  Created the Integrated Technology Index (ITI), a revolutionary approach for assessing space launch concepts for the Highly Reusable Space Transportation Program.

Strategic planner for the Maglev Task Force and the National Maglev Initiative at the Department of Transportation.  Program goals were to create the next generation high speed ground transportation system for the American market.  Assessed German and Japanese technology developments as well as their socio-economic justifications for deploying high speed ground transportation.

Lead investigator of effort to benchmark state-of-the-art engineering and program management systems for the Engineering of Systems in the 21st Century Workshop.  Fields researched included concurrent engineering practices, task-based management, technology development trends, rapid prototyping, and virtual corporations.

basic_info.headline: Founder & CEO at Stealth Mode Startup
Co-Founder at Stealth Mode Startup Company
Founder and CEO at Alignment Health
basic_info.about:
Helping my mom recover from a heart attack years ago  opened my eyes to how truly disconnected and fragmented our health care system is. Even after years of working in the health care industry, I still felt frustrated. There was no advocate to coordinate care for her – we didn’t know what to do, or the kind of specialists and medications she needed during her recovery. I realized there's got to be a better way for my mom and for all the moms and dads out there.

That personal experience led me to my calling – to help seniors get the kind of care and support they need and deserve. That’s why we founded Alignment Health. 

Today, we are aiming to set a new, innovative standard in health care delivery, shifting the focus of health care from payments to people. With 10,000 adults turning 65 every day, the need to ensure our seniors receive the best care is greater than ever.

experience.title: CEO and Founder
experience.description:
Alignment Healthcare is an integrated health care company focused on providing population health management services to health systems, health plans and provider groups across the country. 

I believe that integrated care coordination, innovations in chronic and frail disease management and aligned financial incentives between payors, doctors, hospitals and patients is the only way to improve the country’s health care and health insurance systems.

To achieve these goals, I assembled a management team with more than 360 years of health care delivery and managed care experience to improve the quality of care and outcomes for U.S. seniors at dramatically lower costs.

experience.title: President

basic_info.headline: MLT CEO & Founder
basic_info.about:
John Rice is the CEO and Founder of MLT (www.MLT.org), a nationally recognized nonprofit dedicated to increasing economic mobility and building inclusive, meritocratic workplaces. Today, the organization works with 3,000 predominantly low-and moderate-income college students each year to help them achieve economic mobility and partners with more than 200 major companies on their talent strategies. MLT employs 300 people and has developed 1,000 senior leaders, with 15,000 alumni following in their footsteps across the corporate, nonprofit, and startup arenas.

Rice was named one of Forbes’ Top 30 Social Entrepreneurs and currently serves on the boards of Walker & Dunlop (NYSE: WD), Opendoor (NASDAQ-OPEN), and Morgan Stanley Real Estate’s Prime Property Fund.

experience.title: CEO & Founder
experience.description:
Management Leadership for Tomorrow (MLT) is a non-profit organization that is changing the face of leadership across sectors and driving breakthrough results for individuals and institutions. 

MLT supports high-achieving African Americans, Latinx, and Native Americans with a winning professional playbook, one-on-one coaching, and door-opening relationships that accelerate their career paths from college to MBA to senior leadership. MLT has created a thriving network of more than 10,000 Rising Leaders and is fundamentally transforming the diverse talent pipelines at its partner organizations, including more than 150 leading corporations, nonprofits, and business schools. 

MLT has also established a clear and comprehensive equity standard for employers through the MLT Racial Equity at Work Certifications.

basic_info.about:
🚀 Founder, KH Group | Global Speaker | AI & Web3 Advocate | Forbes “Trailblazer of Tech” | Author (Penguin Random House)

I’m a self-made entrepreneur who built multiple 7-figure companies and one 8-figure brand from the ground up—starting with just $20. Today, everything I’ve created lives under one vision: KH Group, my umbrella company spanning eCommerce, hospitality, media, real estate, and emerging tech.

In 2012, I scaled my first eCommerce brand using predictive AI—before it was cool—to beat big-box retailers in the pricing game. In 2016, I launched Bintana sa Paraiso, now a 5x TripAdvisor Award-winning boutique hotel brand. I believe AI is the ultimate growth edge—and I’ve built proof of that across industries.

🌍 I’m the founder of the Global AI Council, a nonprofit championing AI literacy across 6+ countries. I serve on multiple advisory boards and was honored to speak at Harvard Business School, CNN, and American Express Office Hours (alongside Martha Stewart & Bobbi Brown). I'm also a 2025 World Economic Forum Web3 delegate in Davos for Emerging Tech.

🎤 A 2x TEDx speaker (featured on TED.com), I speak on the future of entrepreneurship, women in tech, and building a limitless life. My upcoming book, Unlimited Possibilities (Penguin Random House, 2025), captures that philosophy.

basic_info.about:
With over 9 years of experience in B2B business development, marketing, product management, app development, video production, and UX/UI design, Katelyn Ho is the visionary behind GuidenAI—an AI-focused Innovation Lab founded in 2024 with her co-founder.

In 2025, Katelyn is dedicated to helping enterprises and dev teams create AI Agents in minutes by launching Broxi AI (2025): The no-code AI Agent Builder.

In 2024, she empowered women travelers with intuitive AI travel planning tools that make adventures more accessible and enjoyable. She created an AI-driven travel app designed to revolutionize how people plan, book, and explore the world. The app got 50,000+ downloads in 2 months after launch. She stopped developing the app in January 2025.

In 2023, she created 3 branding video series for Morgan Stanley. In the same year, she also contributed to 6 marketing campaigns for California Lottery while working at Time Advertising. Katelyn completed her B.S. in Business Administration - Marketing degree from SFSU before starting up again with GuidenAI.

Moreover, Katelyn co-founded a YouTube MCN and marketing agency in 2018. The entrepreneurial spirit was ingrained in her when she owned a comic book business at the age of nine, so you can call her 2x founder or 3x founder as your choice. 

She trained AI models at Scale AI from 2023-2025 as a freelance AI trainer. Teached AI like a kid (from text, image, voice, etc., to video and something else).

basic_info.headline: Advisory Board Member | AI Founder | Impact Investor
basic_info.about:
Laura is the founder and Managing Partner of Accel Impact Ventures, a venture capital firm that invests in pre-seed/seed startups that leverage AI and Deeptech to solve impact problems without sacrificing returns.

She has over eight years of experience in leading tech social impact and ethical AI development, as well as launching and scaling new ventures in the AI and ML space, including the Accel AI Institute, and Latinx in AI (LXAI) organization. These initiatives foster education, innovation, and inclusion in the AI community.

Her academic background is in Biology, Physical Science, and Human Development. She relocated to the San Francisco Bay area to work at the Mathematical Sciences Research Institute before jump-starting her career in software engineering at Intuit revamping their Quickbooks online platform. She is a director with Women Who Code, she has been an advisor for Udacity’s AI and Data Nano degree and an affiliate with the Berkman Klein Center for Internet and Society at Harvard Law. With the Berkman Klein Center, Laura has published research with several collaborative teams on Ethical AI and Data Sovereignty topics. 

She chairs and serves on Program Committees for research workshops at AI and ML conferences including NeurIPS, ICLR, ICML, and ACM FAccT. Recent research areas include reducing bias data representations in machine learning models, the effects of artificial intelligence development for developing countries, and paralleling biological and synthetic neural networks seen in mycology, entomology, and computational science.

She has led sessions on social impact, tech diversity, and ethical AI development for Creative Mornings, Katapult Future Fest, Silicon Valley Future Forum, Tech Inclusion Conference, Thrival Summit, Global Hive Summit, and keynoted the “Future of Work” for the Data and Society Conference at UC Berkeley. Laura has given guest lectures and technical workshops at Google, Santa Clara University Law, Stanford University Computational Social Science, and GTC Deep Learning School. Recently she spoke at TEDx Santa Barbara and has been featured in WITtalks and CIIS podcasts, Xconomy, Verizon News, and Forbes Leadership.

www.LauraNMontoya.com

basic_info.about:
Mark has led go to market in emerging markets for large and small companies, from Google’s initial push into maps in the mid 2000s to Facebook’s early mobile efforts and ultimately launching PayJoy, a Silicon Valley-based fintech, in 20 countries.  He served as VP of Business Development at the Stellar Development Foundation, and is currently pushing the boundaries of AI on the edge with Knapsack.

His focus has been on analyzing  markets, structuring transformational partnerships, hiring highly functional teams in market, and then producing revenue quickly with great unit economics.  He has also raised ~$100M in early stage VC, venture debt, and SPV debt financing across four companies he built, and advised companies on fundraising.

Prior to moving to Silicon Valley in 2006, Mark split his time between India and London, founding and running his first startup, Electrobug Technologies.  As this company had clients in 18 countries and 250+ staff in India through a wholly owned subsidiary, Mark learned firsthand of the challenges and opportunities of working in emerging markets, and is currently an advisor for a number of startups.

Mark graduated magna cum laude from Amherst College with a degree in Economics and History
His main drive is in building interesting products and making them ubiquitous, with a specific focus on access for the underserved.  Views expressed here are his own.

Specialties: business development, search, travel, content licensing, mobile, app development, android, indian outsourcing, offshore labor, social media.

I came on as the first business hire and worked in operations and business development roles to refine the commercial model and scale.

Backed by premier VC's and used by some of the largest companies in the world, Skycatch is a platform for capturing data using small autonomous aerial robots. Since inception, Skycatch has been innovating in multiple different technology areas including photogrammetry, data analytics, and advanced aerial technology, and is now the fastest growing company in the autonomous aerial mapping market.

Skycatch's autonomous data collection platform is built for enterprise with safety, strength and reliability in mind.  It can cover large geographic areas, be equipped with different sensors depending on the customer’s needs, and operate in challenging weather conditions.  Our proprietary battery-swapping and autonomous landing technology gives our aerial robots the ability to scale and operate without human involvement. Construction, Mining, and other complex job sites around the world are turning to Skycatch to satisfy their need for accurate and real time data.

basic_info.headline: Founder … I’m building something insanely cool
basic_info.about:
As the founder and exited CEO of Xenesis, I dedicated my career to advancing space-based optical communications technologies. My journey began in data science, where I worked on special projects for organizations such as ExxonMobil, Google, Apple, the Airlines Reporting Corporation (ARC), and the United States Air Force Research Laboratory (AFRL). These experiences provided me with a solid foundation in data analysis and technology development.

Prior to establishing Xenesis, I worked at the Official Airline Guide, focusing on commercializing global aviation datasets. During this time, I envisioned a global flight tracking solution that utilized satellite technology to modernize flight tracking systems. Recognizing the critical nature and volume of data involved, I shifted my focus from data creation to developing the world's first commercial optical data transport provider. This led to the founding of Xenesis, where we pioneered the delivery of a global optical multilayered mesh network system. Having exited Xenesis ... I am pursuing new passions in data and Team building.

projects.description: Google OneBox gives users access to real-time data through a simple, fast, and easy to configure search interface. A OneBox defines a search type, the keyword that invokes the search, and the way that a search appliance obtains and returns information after a user invokes a search. You can define any number of OneBox modules, and a user search page can display results from multiple OneBox modules.

basic_info.headline: Visionary Entrepreneur & Seasoned Executive | Smithsonian-Recognized Founder | Partnering with Netflix, Google, Meta to Drive Growth
basic_info.about:
I'm a results-driven executive leader and entrepreneur with over 30 years of experience launching, scaling, and leading successful ventures across industries as diverse as action sports media, construction, coworking spaces, hospitality, and event management. Yes, I've worn a lot of hats—some even simultaneously!

My journey began by founding Heckler Magazine, which not only shaped the action sports media landscape but also proudly landed in the archives of the Smithsonian. I've since leveraged that entrepreneurial spirit to build and manage high-performing teams and ventures, collaborating with top-tier clients including Netflix, Google, and Meta. (No, unfortunately, I didn't get free subscriptions or unlimited searches!)

At the core of my leadership philosophy is a commitment to innovation, operational excellence, and cultivating company cultures where diverse voices thrive and creativity flourishes. I have a proven track record of driving revenue growth, optimizing operations, and embracing technology to facilitate sustainable, long-term success.

Currently, I'm exploring opportunities to apply my extensive operational expertise and strategic vision to organizations ready to scale, transform, and make a meaningful impact. If you're searching for a seasoned executive who understands how to grow teams, revenues, and culture (and occasionally crack a joke or two along the way), let's connect!

basic_info.headline: We build Apps & AI for hire. Get funding. Start here. Went from 0 to MVP in 75 days & raised on $10 Mn valuation for Jen (Founder, LovingIs Chicago). Our clients include PwC, U McGill, etc. Get AI/App/SaaS, book a call👇
basic_info.about:
I had a DREAM. Growing up I always wanted to be in marketing. My imagination was boundless and I was considered a creative student by my teachers. As destiny was to have it, my tracks changed. Few years from then, I was in an engineering school where tech became my life. From one competition to another, I raked up a few Tech awards and prizes. So much so that I went on to completing my Masters in engineering. Just as I was starting to have an amazing career, destiny reversed gears again. 

Enter AMERICAS in my life. All of a sudden I was a stranger in a new land, the land of opportunities. Guess what? I didn't even have conversational English skills. As with any immigrant, we think in our mother tongue and convert it into English before talking. On top of it, I graduated from MBA and was unemployed for 9 months. After initial struggles, I took up a sales job that built my conversational English skills and confidence. 

Soon I was in the most fascinating job ever - an intimate lingerie salesman. I loved the job and people were amazing. They came to know about my Tech background and asked me to create an e-commerce website for them. I was able to deliver a user centric high design eCommerce website and a viral digital growth strategy. Once I hit the ball out of the park, I knew I was built for Tech + Marketing. That's where it all started, HonestAI by GrayCyan.

At HAI-GC, we build AI and App Tech that goes VIRAL. We have generated $51 Mn for 550+ brands in the last 7 years. Clients love us for our generosity and helping them build and viral their technology/apps/AI.

If you have an AI project or an tech idea, DM me or book a call (link in bio☝️). Would love build your Tech. Open but selective to equity deals.

I am also the Editor-in-Chief at HonestAI, where are publish monthly AI thought leadership. You can signup for our magazine at: https://honestaiengine.com/ai-magazine/edition-5/flipbook

P.S. American 🇺🇸 pronunciation of my name is Neesh.
Canadian 🇨🇦 pronunciation is Nishhh.

basic_info.headline: CarbonSustain Founder | Berkeley Haas MBA
basic_info.about:
Founder, CarbonSustain | Haas MBA | Sustainability & Carbon Emissions | Technology Leader & Web3 Innovator

Technology leader, entrepreneur, and consultant with 18+ years of experience leading software teams across enterprise web, mobile, AI, blockchain, and Web3. Expert in scaling tech teams, Fortune 500 strategy consulting, and driving innovations in sustainability, digital transformation, and DeFi.

Current Role
Founder & CEO, CarbonSustain – A climate tech startup leveraging AI, blockchain, and automation to help SMBs track carbon emissions, purchase carbon credits, and comply with ESG regulations. Haas MBA from UC Berkeley with expertise in sustainability, carbon accounting, and regulatory compliance.

Professional Experience & Highlights
18+ years leading global software teams in enterprise web, mobile, and digital tech (Android, iOS, Java Spring, Angular, Python/Django).
XRPL Ecosystem Partner – Developing decentralized carbon credit solutions for transparency, verifiability, and liquidity.
Web3 & Blockchain Innovation – Built on-chain carbon credit solutions, fractionalized tokenized credits, and integrated Ethereum, XRPL, and The Graph for decentralized sustainability tracking.
8+ years managing global teams (Poland, Puerto Rico, Mexico, India, Vietnam, UK & US), delivering to Fortune 500 executives.
Serial Entrepreneur:
CarbonSustain – Automating carbon accounting for SMBs using blockchain.
Consulting Business Director – AI, Web, and Mobile development outsourcing.
Kander Inc. – Social media startup with celebrity partner Quincy Jones.
Real Estate Investor – Managing a diversified portfolio.
Industry expertise: Healthcare (Kaiser), public transit (NY MTA), banking (HSBC), defense (UTC), public utilities (Duke Energy), sustainability startups.
Technical Skills
Software & Mobile: Android (Kotlin), iOS (Swift, Objective C), Hybrid apps.
Full-Stack & Web: JavaScript (Angular, React), Java (Spring Boot), Python (Django), PHP, MySQL.
Blockchain & Web3: XRPL, Ethereum, The Graph, smart contracts, NFT utility for sustainability.
AI & ML: AI-driven carbon footprint automation, ESG modeling & reporting.
Cloud & DevOps: AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD automation.
Sustainability & Carbon Markets: Tokenized carbon credits, SB 253 & 261 compliance, ESG reporting.
Vision
Bridging Web3, AI, and climate innovation to create verifiable, transparent, and scalable carbon credit solutions that help businesses achieve net zero through blockchain-powered automation.

projects.name: Predictive Presidential Voting Results based on Public Donations
projects.description:
The main contribution of this study is a careful analysis of the predictive power of donations in battleground states in determining presidential election outcomes. Through a granular analysis of donations data by county in each swing state, and by using PostgreSQL, Python, and Tableau to do so, we perform data analysis, visualization, and RandomForest machine learning to predict that:

Florida, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin will vote “blue” in this election cycle.
Arizona, North Carolina, and Michigan will vote “red” in this election cycle.
Red votes in swing states will make up 42 electoral college votes.
Blue votes in swing states will male up 59 electoral college votes.

3x AI Builder, CEO, CMO, marketer, fundraiser, and investor focused on building and scaling companies using Artificial Intelligence, automation, and data-driven marketing.

Currently partnering with Altamont Capital Partners to drive marketing operations and AI-powered revenue growth across their mid-cap portfolio.

Key Accomplishments:

Revenue-generating company builder: Founded RLLCLL (2014-2017), a programmatic video advertising network with proprietary AI/ML technology capable of 250-millisecond ad serving across 1.5 million websites, then successfully sold the company to Aquarius AI and served as COO through a $30 million CAD raise and IPO on Toronto Venture Stock Exchange in 2018.

Marketing technology architect: Modernized marketing stacks and deployed AI-powered revenue operations across 15+ companies, treating marketing as an operational system. Delivered 40% CAC reduction while increasing sales velocity 2.5x through process automation and data-driven optimization. Portfolio companies achieve 85% marketing-sourced pipeline and 3.2x revenue acceleration within 18 months through systematic marketing operations.

Category-defining brand strategist: Led multiple rebrands, including company name changes, market positioning, and go-to-market strategy, built and restructured marketing teams across hundreds of hires, including a focus on women in technology. 

Scalable revenue operations expert: Developed repeatable marketing + sales ops frameworks deployed across 25+ mid-cap companies. Scaled teams from 5 to 30+ using standardized playbooks, process automation, and performance benchmarking systems, plus AI automation. 

International expansion leader: Ran the US for iClick (ICLK, now AMBR), building all technology and business partnerships for US brands advertising to Chinese consumers. 

AI-powered growth innovator: Early adopter of generative AI for content, lead scoring, and predictive revenue modeling. Built AI-powered marketing operations delivering 10x content output and 60% improvement in lead-to-revenue conversion.

Rolan is also passionate about social welfare and food justice, and serves as an advisory board member for Food Forward, a PBS documentary that showcases the stories and solutions of food heroes across America. Rolan has a Master's in Public Policy from UC Berkeley and spent 5 years in non-profit work in his early 20s.

basic_info.headline: Emerging Real Estate Professional | Relationship-Driven | Exploring Opportunities in Greater Boston & Central MA
basic_info.about:
I came to the U.S. from Brazil at 17, alone, and built my life step by step — first learning English, then building a career in the beauty industry, where I became a master lash artist and later trained hundreds of women to start their own businesses.

Now, I’m starting a new chapter in real estate. For me, it’s about more than buying or selling homes — it’s about guiding people through one of the most meaningful decisions of their lives with trust, care, and honesty.

I believe relationships matter more than transactions. Whether I was helping a beauty client or teaching a new lash artist, or now helping someone find a home, I bring the same values: connection, empowerment, and integrity.

I’m currently preparing to earn my real estate license and building my network in the Greater Boston & Central MA markets. If you’re open to connecting or sharing advice, I’d love to learn from you.

basic_info.headline: Co-Founder & Chief Operating Officer | 2023 Women of Influence Honoree
basic_info.about: Financial wellness education professional and co-author of the award-winning comprehensive financial planning program Destination: Financial Wellness Online and Toolkit that teaches individuals to build wealth the right way.

experience.title: Co-Founder & Chief Operating Officer
experience.description:
Saundra B. Curry is Co-Founder and Chief Operating Officer at BC Holdings of Tennessee, LLC. She is the creator and co-author of the award-winning comprehensive financial planning program Destination: Financial Wellness Online and Toolkit which teaches individuals to build wealth. In her role as COO, she oversees all programs and works with clients to ensure the success of all initiatives. 

BCH is a full-service financial educational training firm for workforce training and development, leveraging more than 50 years in mission-critical financial wellness and program development. BCH’s financial literacy and wellness training motivates, educates and empowers employees throughout the lifecycle of their careers. BCH is a non-fiduciary firm providing educational services only. The company provides financial literacy education for clients such as Army, Navy, Marines, Air Force, Department of Agriculture Job Corps, local governments, state municipalities, higher education institutions, nonprofits and religious organizations. 

BCH meets the financial literacy needs of its clients with customized programs including the following: financial wellness educational training and assessments, creating financial plans for early-earners, mid-career and pre-retirees, professional development and leadership skills training, effective and innovative e-learning engagement platform training, maintaining security clearances, debit/credit management, debt reduction, financial counseling, comprehensive credit report analysis among others. BCH is a GSA contractor, an 8(a) Certified Small Business and Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business through the Small Business Administration as well as a certified Minority Business Enterprise through the State of Tennessee. The company has received numerous national business and industry awards including Forbes 2021 NEXT 1000, Minority Business News 2022 Rising Star Award, and HR Magazine 2022 Top 10 Emerging Financial Wellness Companies.

experience.title: Vice President, Senior Lending Officer
experience.description:
Ms.  Curry  served  as  the  senior  relationship  manager  in  the  Private  Banking  department.  Her responsibilities included finding financial solutions for clients’ banking, lending, investment and estate planning needs. She was often challenged to find creative solutions to provide non-traditional financing for her clients. As a result, she developed a marketing plan to strategically grow the number of minority clients in the department (specifically African American). Prior to her outreach, there were no African American clients out of a total client base of approximately 2,500. Her efforts were hugely successful resulting in an increase of 25 African American clients in six months and the marketing plan was adopted by senior management to increase the number of minority clients including Asians and Hispanics. 

Ms. Curry’s efforts and success in the minority communities led to her appointment as the Relationship Manager for the Tennessee Titans – NFL and Nashville Predators – NHL. She developed impactful financial wellness and awareness programs for both teams along with services such as Bill Paying where a department was formed to pay the bills of both NFL and NHL players. Both programs were a huge success for the client and bank and still exist today. Sustainability of programs is always a leading goal.

experience.title: Affluent Marketing/Strategic Market Manager
experience.description: As the Affluent Marketing and Strategic Market Manager, Ms. Curry developed a new market segment for the bank. She was selected to create and implement a strategy that focused on catering to wealthy clients by offering innovative and elite products and services unmatched by the competition. Upon developing her strategy and marketing plan, her solo presentation to the Board of Directors was unanimously approved. For implementation purposes, she developed a stellar team that delivered at the highest level. The products and services developed are still available at the financial institution.

experience.title: Distribution Manager
experience.description: As Distribution Manager, Ms. Curry was the Project Manager for hiring and managing consultant firms to assist in strategically identifying physical locations for bank branches in the region. During the research process, she became intimately involved in the process including site visits. She delivered and presented the findings and recommendations to senior management for approval. She recommended a design for new branches which was adopted. Ms. Curry was also project leader for determining where to install stand-alone ATMs across the state. Coordinating with the ATM and Facilities Departments, she managed the multi-level process of identifying locations, entering lease agreements and/or land purchases on behalf of the bank, coordinating installations, implementing marketing blitzes and organizing grand openings.

experience.title: Investment Advisor
experience.description:
Ms. Curry was one of the first African American investment advisors in the city of Nashville, Tennessee. She gained her position by being one of nine individuals (out of 350) to be selected as a participant in a new program to train a “new breed” of investment advisors. After successfully completing the program and scoring the highest on the Series 7, she was assigned a territory in rural West Tennessee. Ms. Curry developed a strategic plan and marketing program that entailed putting her “boots on the ground” at every branch location in her territory and building relationships with branch managers. This strategy led to the region becoming one of the top territories for the bank.   

Other advisors adopted her plan and were equally successful. Additionally, due to her knowledge about investing, she began to share investment strategies with family and others in the low- and mid-income communities. Her passion to educate individuals on how to build wealth was born while serving in this role. Ms. Curry learned very quickly the power of investing and taking a long-term view to building wealth. Today she continues to add to the number of people in which she has made an impact, some reaching millionaire status because of her sound counsel. Career highlights include: managed more than $75 million in investable assets; earned her Series 7 and Series 6 certifications and Health & Life Insurance licenses.

experience.title: President & CEO, Founder

Personal MBA Coach was awarded the #1 boutique firm of 2024 and 2023 on Poets and Quants and for 2024 we have the #1 consultant globally (Scott Edinburgh). Personal MBA Coach was founded in 2008 to offer a boutique and personalized level of application support unavailable at other firms. Our approach is unique and, unlike with many other consultancies, you will not be handed off to a junior consultant who works with a few clients a year and has limited insight into the application process. All Personal MBA Coach clients work directly with our founder, Scott Edinburgh or a former M7 admissions director. This means you work directly with an expert throughout the entire process. 

Personal MBA Coach helps clients with all aspects of the MBA application process including early planning, GMAT/GRE/EA tutoring, application strategy, school selection, essay editing, and mock interviews. Our team includes former M7 admissions directors and former M7 admissions interviewers. We work with a select number of applicants each year and place them into the best MBA, EMBA, part-time MBA and other graduate school programs.

Our clients not only get admitted, but many also receive substantial scholarships. Last year our clients received over $11M in merit scholarships.

basic_info.headline: Co-Founder and CEO of Ohai.ai, Founder of Care.com
basic_info.about:
Sheila Lirio Marcelo has more than 20 years of leadership experience in internet consumer marketplace businesses, including as the Co-Founder and Chief Executive Officer of Ohai.ai, a cutting edge technology startup leveraging generative AI to improve the lives of families. She was a former Venture Partner at New Enterprise Associates (NEA) and is a founding board member of The Asian American Foundation (TAAF). Ms. Marcelo previously founded Care.com in 2006 and took it public in 2014; she was Chairwoman and CEO until early 2020, when the company was sold to IAC.

Ms. Marcelo has been honored with numerous accolades. She was just named on Forbes 50 Over 50. She was one of Fortune’s "Top 10 Women Entrepreneurs" and appeared at Fortune's Most Powerful Women Summit. She is a Henry Crown Fellow with the Aspen Institute, a Young Global Leader of the World Economic Forum, and a member of the Council on Foreign Relations. 

Ms. Marcelo earned a B.A. from Mount Holyoke College, which also conferred upon her an honorary Doctorate of Humane Letters in 2015. She has a J.D. and M.B.A. with honors from Harvard University. In 2014, Marcelo became the youngest recipient of the Harvard Business School Alumni Achievement Award.

location.full: New York, New York, United States

experience.title: Founder and CEO
experience.location: New York, New York, United States
experience.description:
Ohai.ai is a cutting-edge technology startup leveraging AI to improve the lives of families through an AI household assistant backed by a team of humans. Launched in January 2024, this groundbreaking product is designed to lighten the load for busy parents. Meet O, the virtual assistant, who helps with managing schedules, coordinating family tasks, setting reminders, sorting through emails, and more.

The Ohai.ai team consists of early employees of Care.com, data science and AI experts, and product and engineering leaders from beloved consumer brands. As parents themselves, they deeply understand the pressing need for effective solutions for managing the chaos of family life.

experience.title: Founder, Chairwoman, & CEO of Care.com
experience.description: Our mission is to improve the lives of families and caregivers by helping them connect in a reliable and easy way. Our solutions help families to make informed decisions in one of the most important and highly considered aspects of their family life—finding and managing quality care for their family—their children, parents, pets and other loved ones. In providing families a comprehensive marketplace for care, we are building the largest destination for quality caregivers to find fulfilling employment and career opportunities globally. We strive to help our members—families and caregivers—pursue their passions and fulfill the basic human need of caring for each other.

experience.title: Venture Partner

(NEA) is a global venture capital firm focused on helping entrepreneurs build transformational businesses across multiple stages, sectors and geographies. With nearly $24 billion in cumulative committed capital since the firm’s founding in 1977, NEA invests in technology and healthcare companies at all stages in a company’s lifecycle, from seed stage through IPO. The firm's long track record of successful investing includes more than 230 portfolio company IPOs and more than 390 mergers and acquisitions. www.nea.com.

basic_info.headline:
“The Curiosity Coach” (CPCC) (ACC) for Presence/Accountability in Change, Ambiguity, and Innovation
/ Founder
basic_info.about:
Livelihood in Change  |  Passionate About Enhancing Personal and Organizational Curiosity for Wisdom and Accountability in Change 

Taking responsibility and starting new ventures in today’s volatile, uncertain, innovative and global environment can be hard.

Are you a person who is inspired by opportunities but sense or feel discouraged by uncertainty? Are you ready to partner with the empowering and enabling space of curiosity -the space of not knowing, learning, and making progress - where you are free to re-examine all that you currently know and more, to be present with change, recover quickly from setbacks, and lead with adaptability and imagination? I look forward to meeting with you.

I’m Şirin Köprücü, The Curiosity Coach. I support organizations and leaders in uncertainty, ambiguity, and innovation. I work with C-suite executives, CEOs, start-up founders, and emerging transformational talent who choose curiosity over fear and can challenge the status quo to thrive rather than struggle, stagnate, or ignore in today’s fast-paced, ever-evolving global and technological environment.  My clients describe me as a kind coach whose intuition is spot on.

My passion for and conviction about the power of curiosity comes from a multicultural upbringing, a corporate career in the innovative and global space of  Hoffmann-La Roche and Novartis, and living and working in five countries speaking three languages. I’ve coached leaders worldwide, including through executive programs at the Thunderbird School of Global Management and Stanford Graduate School of Business.  I care deeply about impact and witness influential and impactful leaders when they believe in and practice their curiosity instead of fear or ignorance in the context of an unknown.

Certified as a Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) and holding an ACC credential from the ICF, I also bring expertise in Global Mindset®, GlobeSmart®, and Quantum Negotiation™.

In my experience, nothing is too difficult, unimaginable, or impossible when approached with one’s curiosity.

To enrich leadership and execution:

Schedule an INTRODUCTION TO THE GLOBAL MINDSET if you would like to identify your strengths and development areas in building influence - creating shared value and working well with others unlike you.

Schedule an INTRODUCTION TO QUANTUM NEGOTIATION if you would like to explore the art of getting what you need.

Interested legal professionals can find me on https://www.acc.com/career-coaching with the Association of Corporate Counsel.

experience.title: Senior Software Engineer
experience.description: I work in Azure Storage, as part of Front-End (FE) team, building highly scalable I/O intensive services for Blobs, Queues, Files and Tables.

experience.title: Software Engineer II
experience.description:
I work in Azure Storage, as part of Front-End (FE) team, building highly scalable I/O intensive services for Blobs, Queues, Files and Tables.

I own, develop and maintain two critical parts of FE infrastructure: a cache for storage resources and an in-memory partition map. I re-designed the node-local cache architecture to expand to a 2-tier model, with a tenant-wide distributed cache serving as L2, to reduce backend load and serve as a safety net during temporary backend failures. I also optimized partition map refreshes to achieve significant performance improvement, providing higher scalability to a larger number of partitions.

I designed and built a highly async, low-latency FE provider layer for a new high-performance Premium Storage service for IAAS, interfacing between the service and backend layers, achieving significant reduction in most request latencies in FE. You can read about Premium Storage here:

https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/storage-premium-storage

I also implemented CPU-based request throttling for Premium Storage and added support for load-balancer probes, enabling quick isolation of unhealthy roles and removal from active rotation for debugging without traffic disruption. .

I developed a BVT framework for FE, enabling fluid test case development while granting greater control over requests and responses for each test. The framework enables data-driven testing, and automates test platform detection, configuration selection, test versioning, account management and response parsing, allowing developers to focus on core test case logic.

experience.title: Software Engineer I
experience.description:
I worked in Azure Storage, as part of the Front-End (FE) team, building highly scalable I/O intensive services for Blobs, Queues, Files and Tables. I implemented several of the File REST API. You can read about the API here:

https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn167006.aspx

I worked on two critical parts of FE infrastructure: a node-local cache for storage resources and an in-memory partition map. I designed and implemented several key features for the cache, including proactive refreshes for near-expiry hot entries, and resiliency to temporary backend failures while sustaining >99% hit ratio.

The partition map tracks the backend partition layout and status of each partition: bootstrapping, un/healthy, migrating to a different node, etc. I developed a lightweight probe for querying partition status and added smart failure recovery from layout/status changes to improve request latencies and avoid overloading hot partitions.

I developed an algorithm for optimizing Table query performance, significantly improving the minimal scan range for several query types from full-Table/multi-Partition scans to sub-Partition scans. Table query best practices are documented here:

https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/windowsazurestorage/how-to-get-most-out-of-windows-azure-tables

experience.title: Research Assistant
experience.description:
I worked as a Research Assistant in the SysNet Lab at UCSD under Dr. Kenneth Yocum. My primary area of focus was Data Provenance in large-scale data analytics. I published the results of my research in the SoCC 2013.

I designed an efficient mechanism to identify and track provenance information for MapReduce jobs in Hadoop and developed a cost model for leveraging provenance to identify re-generable files from MapReduce jobs in HDFS that may be deleted to efficiently reclaim space.

I further extended this idea to develop a scalable and efficient mechanism to capture provenance
information for high-throughput DISC systems. I also implemented a framework to leverage this information to enable fine-grain tracing and replay through DISC dataflows, and provide step-wise debugging, anomaly detection and partial output regeneration capabilities for DISC analytics.

experience.title: Graduate Teaching Assistant
experience.description: I was a teaching assistant for CSE 105 Theory of Computation ungraduate course, working under Dr. Cynthia Bailey Lee. I was responsible for conducting discussion sessions in class, setting homework questions, grading, holding office hours and conducting review sessions before tests.

basic_info.headline: Co-founder, Cocreate (YC S25) | Computer Science & Music @ Stanford University
basic_info.about:
Stanford CS |  Musician |  Entrepreneurship

I’ve always found myself drawn to the intersections where ideas collide—whether it’s music and technology, art and business, or creativity and logic. Growing up, my days were split between tinkering with computers and losing myself in music. Fast forward to now, as a Computer Science major at Stanford, I’m still chasing that blend of precision and passion.

On the technical side, Stanford has been my playground for tackling complex problems—whether it’s writing efficient algorithms, designing systems, or diving deep into the nuances of code. I love the challenge of solving puzzles that push my thinking to new levels.

But it’s music that keeps me grounded. Playing instruments, composing, or just sitting in on a jam session—music feels like my second language. It’s taught me how to collaborate, listen, and experiment, which I bring into every part of my life, including my work.  

At the same time, I’ve always had an entrepreneurial itch—the kind that makes me question how things work and imagine how they could be better. Lately, I’ve been drawn to the question: *What does the future of music look like?* Whether it’s building platforms to connect artists, designing tools to simplify the creative process, or finding ways to make the industry more equitable, I want to be a part of shaping what’s next.

Right now, I’m looking for opportunities to bring my skills to meaningful projects—places where technology, creativity, and big ideas intersect. If you’re working on something bold, let’s talk. I’d love to explore how we can build something that matters.

Let's connect and explore how we can combine our passions to create something extraordinary. Reach out to me here or via email at tamish01@stanford.edu. I'm excited to connect with industry professionals, fellow entrepreneurs, and music enthusiasts to forge meaningful collaborations and drive innovation.

basic_info.headline: Freelance Creative & Co-Founder of Havok Publishing
basic_info.about:
It's no secret I'm a change agent.

At graduation I was horrified by the prospect of spending decades doing the same job. So I entered the tech industry, became a web designer and Internet marketing professional and have done something new every day since. Still, you can expect some common threads to appear when we work together:

- Enthusiasm. Insight. Seeing beyond the immediate problem to the overall puzzle into which it fits.

- Honesty. Optimism. No matter where we are, there is a path that leads upward.

- Experience. Savvy. A few decades have tempered the passions of youth and formed a pragmatic approach for long-term results.

The status quo is ever my arch-nemesis, which is why even my fiction challenges my characters (and my readers) to shifts in perspective.

Currently co-running a volunteer-driven publishing company, developing a half-dozen special-interest websites, writing flash fiction and several non-fiction projects. Exploring opportunities to share my skills in new places with other creatives doing great work.

experience.title: Marketing & Technology Director
experience.description:
Havok Publishing offers original flash fiction by authors from around the world every weekday at gohavok.com. Read a free story every day or join our paid membership for access to the full archives and participation in our reader contests.

In my role at Havok, I co-manage ~50 volunteers to publish daily ezine stories and bi-annual anthologies (ebook and print). As marketing and art director, I maintain our brand and direct internal and external communication strategies. As an enthusiastic encourager of creatives, I often: brainstorm plots, characters, and new story worlds; beta read and offer developmental feedback; teach workshops on relevant writing and marketing topics.

experience.title: Owner
experience.description:
In the web design business professionally since 1996. Specialties: Wordpress web design and training, writing (fiction, non-fiction, corporate), illustration / graphic design, online content organization and presentation. Most common projects: website re-designs and converting sites to Wordpress for small-to-medium size businesses and solo entrepreneurs.

Not taking new clients at the moment. Currently developing a number of content publishing projects and learning new technologies.

experience.title: Freelance Writer
experience.description:
I've been writing stories and articles of varying lengths for years. I've been published in local newspapers, trade journals, blogs, magazines. I've worked with other authors to brainstorm, beta read, and do developmental editing. I've professionally self-published my own work and co-founded a flash fiction publishing company that has published hundreds of authors and produced two science fiction / fantasy anthologies per year for the last five years. I live and breathe storytelling and communication in a variety of creative and corporate contexts.

I am a student of the entertainment industry: film, video games, comics, and music. I'm constantly analyzing what's working, what's trending, how the narratives of pop culture reflect the desires of the modern audience. This experience comes into play when offering feedback to other creatives on their work, designing my own massive story universe, and even shaping the messaging of the marketing efforts of my entrepreneurial ventures.

education.description: After going into the Internet industry, I found on-the-job training and independent learning far more effective than formal school. Haven't had a reason to return, although I enjoyed college well enough. Real (and ongoing) experience in the tech industry is the only way to stay up with the changes!

basic_info.headline: Co-Founder | Outcomes using AI | Fraud Investigation for BFSI | Gen AI Automation
basic_info.about:
I am a Data Scientist turned Entrepreneur, I embarked on a journey to build Yugen to help Enterprises achieve "Outcomes" using a combination of Yugen's Products & Services.

We noticed that many companies adopt AI because of the hype, but without a clear strategy, most of these projects fail to deliver real results. That's where we come in! 💪🏻

At Yugen, we combine strategy, technology, and execution to ensure our clients get real ROI from AI. 

We focus on solving specific challenges in different industries with a blend of services and innovative products, such as:

✅ GameIntel: Offers game studios and publishers deep insights into player behavior and engagement, helping them make informed decisions.

✅ FileX: A Gen AI product for Law Firms which moves & categorizes documents from their mailrooms to their Case Management Systems while extracting important information saving hundreds of man-hours per week.

✅ Canso.ai: Provides real-time fraud detection and decision-making for banks, fintech, e-commerce, and ad-tech companies.

✅ ARS: Assists fashion retailers in reducing stock-outs and optimizing inventory, ultimately increasing sales and efficiency.

If you're interested in exploring how AI can benefit your organization or just want to chat about the latest in AI and technology, feel free to reach out using:

https://calendar.app.google/rvc44dkzZLEVz8ep7

I'm always open to connecting with like-minded professionals and exchanging ideas. 😁

basic_info.headline: American Banker Top 20 Most Influential Women in Fintech | 3x Book Author | New Book: Banking on Artificial Intelligence (2025) | Founder — Unconventional Ventures  | Podcast — One Vision | Public Speaker | Top Voice
basic_info.about:
Theo is a public speaker, writer, and advisor, who work seeks to spark innovation in the public and private sectors for the benefits of the forgotten demographics and to create a more inclusive society. She is the founder of Unconventional Ventures, which focuses on developing and growing an ecosystem of financial institutions, corporations, startups, entrepreneurs, venture capitalists, and accelerators to better address the unmet needs of consumers, with keen interests in women and underrepresented founders. As part of her work, she regularly mentors and advises startups in both financial services and healthcare/caregiving space. She is the advisor for B21 Ventures, focusing on entrepreneurs disrupting finance and health with AI.

Theo speakers regularly on the topics of AI, Gender Equity, FinTech, Inclusion, and Longevity. She is a guest contributor for various top industry events, publications, and podcasts, including Fintech Futures, American Banker, BBC, Journal of Digital Banking, Harvard Business Review, Nikkei Asia, MIT Tech Review, Money20/20, Finovate, RISE, FinTech Week Hong Kong, Breaking Banks, Financial Brand, Irish Tech News, and Forbes Technology Councils.

She is the author of Banking on (Artificial) Intelligence (2025). She is also the co-author of Beyond Good - How technology is leading a purpose-driven business revolution (2021), and co-author of The Metaverse Economy (2023). She is the host of One Vision, a podcast on innovation and fintech, runs a weekly LinkedIn newsletter (FinTech Prose) on emerging technologies (such as Voice and AI), inclusion, longevity, fintech, innovation, and using technology for good. Her monthly column on Fintech Futures explores the intersection of fintech and humanity. 

She holds a Bachelor of Science in Chemical Engineering from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute (RPI), and a Master of Science in Project Management from George Washington University.

Wa'il Ashshowwaf is a dynamic entrepreneur with a passion for making a difference in the world. He considers himself a tech-savvy troublemaker with a heart for doing good. 

As the founder of Unstuck Labs, a startup studio that supports underprivileged entrepreneurs, Wa'il has helped the company earn recognition as DC's coolest company and a Innovators on Fire by the Washington Business Journal. He also serves as CEO and co-founder of REYETS: Social Justice Network, a recipient of the World Changing Ideas award and 51 AI. 

With a diverse background that includes positions at major companies such as Disney World, Pepsi, and HSBC, Wa'il's professional experience is extensive. He has a well-rounded education, having studied at Harvard, Georgetown, and Cal State, and he is a board member at American University's KOGOD School of Business. Wa'il is a highly-regarded professional fellow and speaker at the US Department of State's Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs.

“Wa'il is a hugely likable individual who builds rapport quickly and intuitively. An extrovert who keeps himself stimulated by seeking out new challenges and new thinking. The most exceptional talent in terms of marketing and communication that we have yet to come across. His positive, optimistic outlook and passionate approach drove everyone forward. He thrived in the spotlight, yet his sensitivity to others (high EQ) ensured he never monopolized the spotlight. He is in tune with what it actually means to be a customer and he has the mindset and skill set that absolutely epitomizes effective brand and corporate communication.”

basic_info.headline: Building AI that understands people | CEO & Co-Founder at Supercopy | Turning personas into AI magic—and finding joy in the chaos of startup life⚡
basic_info.about:
Hey y'all! 👋

I’m William, an Atlanta native with a passion for solving real problems for real people through user-centric design.

I’m a 4x founder, industrial designer by trade, early AI adopter, and a learned marketer with 5+ years of startup-building. Before jumping into the entrepreneurial void, I worked as a consultant for Fortune 100 companies and scrappy startups alike, tackling complex challenges across industries. My latest experiment turned product , SuperCopy, was born out of my own marketing agency’s need for better tools to streamline content creation and maintain brand consistency.

As the co-founder and CEO of SuperCopy, I’m on a mission to create AI solutions that genuinely make life easier for marketing teams. How? By listening – a lot. I’ve had thousands of conversations with marketers, from solo freelancers to Fortune 500 VPs, to truly understand what they need to succeed.
I’m not just building AI for the sake of technology – we’re creating tech that truly understands the “why” behind people. My experience as a designer and researcher has taught me that the best solutions come from deeply understanding the people who use them. That belief drives everything that I am doing at Supercopy. Every feature we build is designed to adapt to the unique needs of people, not the other way around. 

Here's the million-dollar question I am solving for… How much time and creative energy could your team reclaim with an AI platform that knows your brand voice AND your audience better than you do? 🤔

Remember, assumptions don't build great solutions – users do. We learned that the hard way (so you don’t have to 😅).

Outside the office, you can find me hunting down Atlanta’s best vegetarian tacos, asking way too many questions, or hiking through a National Park.

I am also 100% focused on extending healthy, productive life for everyone on the planet. By citizenship, I am Canadian and Latvian. Any kind of war is against my religion, and I can not support any kind of war, military action, or disturbance of peace. I believe that countries and people need to work together to fight diseases and make the world more sustainable.

In 2014, I founded Insilico Medicine (www.insilico.com) a global clinical-stage generative AI drug discovery. Until 2019, it was an AI-first drug discovery company, with most of the team focused exclusively on developing and applying deep learning methods to drug discovery. Insilico is the original inventor of multiple drug discovery technologies with multiple granted and pending patents in biomarker development and generative chemistry and generative biology. In 2019 the company started working on its own therapeutic programs focusing predominantly on immunology, oncology, fibrosis, and CNS. It also made its industrial-strength target discovery platforms (PandaOmics) and generative chemistry (Chemistry42) platforms available for licensing and partnering. It raised over $500 million from expert healthcare, biotechnology, and technology investors, and entered 2 Phase II clinical trials with the novel target discovered using AI and novel molecule designed using AI. Since 2019, Insilico nominated 22 preclinical candidates, 10 reached clinical stage, 1 completed Phase 2a. 

I also founded, co-chair and personally sponsor the largest global non-profit conference on aging research and drug discovery - Aging Research and Drug Discovery (ARDD), www.AgingPharma.org. In 2024, the University of Copenhagen will host 11th annual ARDD - please register early as it usually sells out in advance.

experience.title: Chief Executive Officer and Chief Business Officer
experience.description: Since founding Insilico Medicine I explored multiple business models, partnership and collaboration strategies as the company evolved from algorithms to software to assets to fully-integrated agile biotech with massive automated labs and real drug discovery benchmarks. I am now expanding my role to transform the way business development in the pharmaceutical industry with the help of generative AI and new leadership style.

experience.title: Founder and CEO
experience.description:
Insilico Medicine (www.insilico.com) is a global clinical-stage generative AI-powered drug discovery and development company founded in 2014. Until 2019 it was an AI-first drug discovery company with most of the team focused exclusively on developing and applying deep learning methods to drug discovery focusing on generative approaches. Insilico is the original inventor of multiple drug discovery technologies with multiple granted and pending patents in biomarker development, generative chemistry, and generative biology. In 2019 the company started working on its own therapeutic programs focusing predominantly on immunology, oncology, fibrosis, CNS, metabolic diseases, and pain. It also made its industrial-strength target discovery platforms (PandaOmics) and generative chemistry (Chemistry42) platforms available for licensing and partnering. It raised over $400 million from expert healthcare, biotechnology, and technology investors, nominated 22 preclinical candidates, 10 programs reached clinical stage. One program completed Phase IIa with good safety and unexpected dose-dependent efficacy in IPF with the novel target discovered using generative AI and novel molecule designed using generative AI.
