experience.title: Scientific Advisor
experience.description: Provided valuable scientific advice and guidance to a group of bright young AI scientists on machine vision for skincare research especially in the context of aging and longevity.  Advised the company CEO, Anastasia Georgievskaya, a brilliant former student and research collaborator on starting a company. Provided the team with personal research grants at first and then with seed funding to start a company and produce the MVP. Participated in several research projects related to tracking wrinkle formation, assessment of subjective age and appearance, balancing of the datasets, and series of tests to ensure race-agnostic system performance.

experience.title: Chief Longevity Officer
experience.description:
Deep Longevity was acquired by Regent Pacific (HK: 0575) and my title has changed to Chief Longevity Officer. In this advisory capacity, I am advising the development of new biomarkers of aging and longevity.

Deep Longevity spun out of Insilico Medicine, independently raised the round A of funding, launched the Young.ai app and Young.ai web services, partnered with multiple clinics and launched an educational course.

experience.title: Founder and CEO
experience.description:
At Insilico Medicine I invented and co-invented a range of biomarkers of aging and longevity utilizing modern artificial intelligence techniques, published seminal papers, and filed for patents some of which were granted. We also discovered several mechanisms driving the aging process and invented interventions targeting these mechanisms. Deep Longevity was incubated by Insilico Medicine to further develop and commercialize these aging clocks and help power the nascent longevity biotechnology industry.   
Deep Longevity is developing explainable artificial intelligence systems to track the rate of aging at the molecular, cellular, tissue, organ, system, physiological, and psychological levels. It is also developing systems for the emerging field of longevity medicine enabling physicians to make better decisions on the interventions that may slow down, or reverse the aging processes. Deep Longevity developed Longevity as a Service (LaaS)© solution to integrate multiple deep biomarkers of aging dubbed “deep aging clocks” to provide a universal multifactorial measure of human biological age. Originally incubated by Insilico Medicine, Deep Longevity started its independent journey in 2020 after securing a round of funding from the most credible venture capitalists specializing in biotechnology, longevity, and artificial intelligence. ETP Ventures, Human Longevity and Performance Impact Venture Fund, BOLD Capital Partners, Longevity Vision Fund, LongeVC, co-founder of Oculus, Michael Antonov, and other expert AI and biotechnology investors supported the company. Deep Longevity established a research partnership with one of the most prominent longevity organizations, Human Longevity, Inc. to provide a range of aging clocks to the network of advanced physicians and researchers.

experience.title: Advisor
experience.description:
In 2008 I helped establish the first non-profit organization in the UK exclusively focused on biogerontology. Until 2016 I remained a trustee of the organization. We funded a number of projects in regenerative medicine, supported conferences, and produced analytical reports. In 2016-/2017 I had to stop active involvement with the charity to focus exclusively on Insilico Medicine.  
The Biogerontology Research Foundation (registered UK charity #1124054) is funding research to develop interventions that remediate the molecular damage underlying the diseases of ageing. To partner or get involved, please don't hesitate to contact the trustees.

basic_info.headline: Founder & CEO at NeuroVision AI Tech & FROM YOUR EYES| Microsoft Imagine Cup World Champion | Microsoft Women Tech Leader | NVIDIA Partner|Pioneer in Artificial Vision Innovation
basic_info.about:
As the visionary entrepreneur behind NeuroVision AI Tech and FROM YOUR EYES, I am dedicated to transforming the realm of artificial vision, enabling both humans and machines to perceive the world with unprecedented clarity and understanding. My deep personal experience with visual impairment fuels my unwavering passion to bridge the gap between human and artificial vision, developing groundbreaking technologies that enhance accessibility, revolutionize industries, and redefine the future of visual experiences.
At the helm of NeuroVision AI Tech, I have led the creation of advanced AI models and APIs that leverage deep learning to deliver exceptional image processing capabilities. These solutions, designed to meet the unique needs of individuals and businesses alike, have earned widespread acclaim, culminating in our crowning achievement as the world champions at the prestigious Microsoft Imagine Cup 2024.
Beyond my entrepreneurial efforts, I am deeply committed to fostering a culture of innovation and empowering others to reach their full potential. As a Google Women TechMaker, a Microsoft Women Leaders Directing Technology Winner, and a Microsoft Learn Student Ambassador, I have actively advocated for the advancement of technology among young leaders, inspiring and mentoring the next generation of tech innovators.
My journey is a testament to the transformative power of technology and the boundless potential of the human spirit. I believe that artificial vision holds the key to unlocking a world of limitless possibilities, where humans and machines can collaborate seamlessly to create a future defined by enhanced understanding, accessibility, and innovation.
 
This revised version integrates both companies and highlights your leadership, achievements, and commitment to innovation and mentorship.

experience.title: Founder
experience.description:
NeuroVision AI Tech is a pioneering technology company specializing in artificial vision solutions that bridge the gap between biological and machine vision. The company develops and licenses advanced AI models and APIs that are designed for real-time image and video processing, offering customization and localization to meet the specific needs of various industries.
NeuroVision AI Tech API
The company's flagship API enables businesses, developers, and startups to integrate sophisticated visual data processing capabilities into their applications. This API offers high accuracy, processing images in just 15 milliseconds with a remarkable accuracy rate of 98.03%, capable of identifying 865 distinct colors. These AI models are trained on a unique dataset of over 15 million visual data points, ensuring they operate closely to human perception.
Business Model
NeuroVision AI Tech operates on a licensing model, allowing its advanced AI models and APIs to be used by external businesses and developers. This model supports a wide range of applications, providing clients with the tools needed to integrate cutting-edge artificial vision technology into their own products and services.
Industry Applications
NeuroVision AI Tech’s solutions are tailored for key sectors including:
• Automotive: Enhancing vehicle safety and accessibility through advanced artificial vision technology.
• Civil Aviation (Airports and Airlines): Providing innovative solutions for airport management and airline operations, improving safety and passenger experience.
• Accessibility: Empowering visually impaired individuals with AI-driven applications that facilitate better interaction with their surroundings.
Sectors Served
NeuroVision AI Tech serves industries in:
• Automotive
• Civil Aviation (Airports and Airlines)
• Accessibility
The company's mission is to revolutionize how machines and humans perceive the world, fostering innovation and enhancing accessibility across sectors.

experience.title: Professional development
experience.description:
My journey to entrepreneurship took an early turn in September 2021 when I embarked on my pre-freshman year at Boğaziçi University. With a strong command of English, I saw an opportunity to accelerate my career path by maximizing my first semester.
Before the semester ended, I embarked on a strategic nine-month plan, fueled by a desire to expand my horizons and personal development. During this time, I was selected as a Microsoft Student Ambassador and continued my professional work at WeWalk, managing users across 135 countries.
Driven by an insatiable thirst for knowledge and a yearning to make a global impact, I took on the leadership role for Bilimle Buluş, a program jointly launched by YGA and Bayer. These diverse experiences provided me with a global perspective, exposure to corporate culture, and invaluable hands-on experience in sales, marketing, user experience, and product development – all crucial elements in building From Your Eyes.
As I took on more responsibilities, my leadership skills flourished, and I gained a deeper understanding of the intricacies of running a successful enterprise. In June, I made the decision to step away from WeWalk and YGA to fully focus on From Your Eyes. Simultaneously, I graduated from Microsoft's Imagine program, providing a solid foundation for our startup's journey.
With a clear career development plan in place, we completed From Your Eyes' MVP, accelerated our growth through Çekirdek and BTM Pre-Incubation programs, and introduced From Your Eyes to its first users. This strategic approach has been one of my most rewarding decisions.
I am immensely proud of this journey and the person I have become. From humble beginnings to navigating the crossroads of global impact and personal growth, I am excited to continue making a difference in the world through From Your Eyes.

experience.title: Onboarding program manager
experience.description:
My passion for empowering the visually impaired community goes hand-in-hand with WeWalk, the world's first smart cane. This incredible story began in 2019 when I became one of WeWalk's very first users. Witnessing the life-changing impact of this technology ignited a fire within me.
Determined to make WeWalk accessible to more people, I spearheaded a successful Change.org campaign with over 217,000 supporters. This advocacy cemented my role as a WeWalk ambassador. During my first year of university, I took a bold step by prioritizing WeWalk and taking a seven-month break from studies. My dedication paid off when, after just one month as a WeWalk intern, I identified a crucial need – user onboarding across 135 countries.
This resulted in the creation of the WeWalk Academy Onboarding program, which I launched in January 2022. Since then, I've thrived as the WeWalk Onboarding Program Manager, ensuring seamless product adoption for our global user base.
This revised bio highlights your initiative, leadership qualities, and the impact you've made at WeWalk. It also streamlines the timeline for better readability.
